10000000-volt-thunderbolt.Name: 10,000,000 Volt
10000000-volt-thunderbolt.Effects: 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt is an Electric type Z-Move exclusive to Cap Pikachu. It is used with Thunderbolt. 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt deals damage and has a sharply increased critical hit ratio (1⁄2 instead of 1⁄24)

absorb.Name: Absorb
absorb.Effects: Absorb deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Absorb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100
absorb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Absorb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

accelerock.Name: Accelerock
accelerock.Effects: Accelerock deals damage and has high priority. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Accelerock turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100
accelerock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Accelerock turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

acid.Name: Acid
acid.Effects: Acid deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100
acid.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

acid-armor.Name: Acid Armor
acid-armor.Effects: Acid Armor raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Armor turns into Z-Acid Armor and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
acid-armor.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Armor turns into Z-Acid Armor and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

acid-downpour.Name: Acid Downpour
acid-downpour.Effects: Acid Downpour is the Poison type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

acid-spray.Name: Acid Spray
acid-spray.Effects: Acid Spray inflicts damage and lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Spray turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100
acid-spray.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Spray turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.

acrobatics.Name: Acrobatics
acrobatics.Effects: Acrobatics deals damage, however, if the user is not holding an item, its power doubles to 110. If the user is holding a Flying Gem, it is consumed before the Pokémon attacks, so it receives both boosts and increases Acrobatics' power to 143 (or 165 in Generation 5). Once the Gem is consumed Acrobatics' power for the rest of the battle will be 110. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acrobatics turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100
acrobatics.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acrobatics turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100.
acrobatics.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

acupressure.Name: Acupressure
acupressure.Effects: Acupressure raises a random stat - Attack, Defense, Speed, Special Attack, Special Defense, Accuracy or Evasion - by two stages. It will always choose a stat that is not already maximized. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Acupressure is unlike other status moves in that it can be targeted at itself or an adjacent teammate. It cannot be used on an ally if they are behind a Substitute, but the user can apply Acupressure to itself if behind a Substitute. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acupressure turns into Z-Acupressure and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
acupressure.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acupressure turns into Z-Acupressure and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
acupressure.Target: Targets either the user or an adjacent Pokémon on the user’s team.

aerial-ace.Name: Aerial Ace
aerial-ace.Effects: Aerial Ace deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aerial Ace turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120
aerial-ace.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aerial Ace turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
aerial-ace.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

aeroblast.Name: Aeroblast
aeroblast.Effects: Aeroblast deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aeroblast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180
aeroblast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aeroblast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.

after-you.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, After You turns into Z-After You and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

ancient-power.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ancient Power turns into Continental Crush and has base power 120.

aqua-jet.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aqua Jet turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Attract turns into Z-Attract and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

aurora-beam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

aurora-veil.Effects: Aurora Veil halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns. It can only be used during hail or snow, but the effects continue if the weather changes or subsides. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Veil turns into Z-Aurora Veil and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above

autotomize.Effects: Autotomize raises the user's Speed by two stages and reduces its weight by 100kg (to a minimum of 0.1kg). Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Decreasing weight affects these moves: The effect of the weight change cannot be Baton-Passed (but the Speed change is passed as normal). When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Autotomize turns into Z-Autotomize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
autotomize.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Autotomize turns into Z-Autotomize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

avalanche.Effects: Power doubles if user took damage first.

axe-kick.Name: Axe Kick
axe-kick.Effects: May confuse opponent. If it misses, the user loses HP

baby-doll-eyes.Name: Baby-Doll Eyes
baby-doll-eyes.Effects: Baby-Doll Eyes lowers the target's Attack by one stage, with increased priority. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baby-Doll Eyes turns into Z-Baby-Doll Eyes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
baby-doll-eyes.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baby-Doll Eyes turns into Z-Baby-Doll Eyes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

baddy-bad.Effects: Baddy Bad deals damage and reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Reflect). Baddy Bad is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl

baneful-bunker.Name: Baneful Bunker
baneful-bunker.Effects: Baneful Bunker prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Baneful Bunker user on that turn, the attacker becomes poisoned. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. The effects do not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Baneful Bunker drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or King's Shield. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baneful Bunker turns into Z-Baneful Bunker and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
baneful-bunker.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baneful Bunker turns into Z-Baneful Bunker and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

The Skill Link ability will cause Barrage to always hit the maximum number of times. baton-pass.Name: Baton Pass
baton-pass.Effects: Baton Pass causes the user to switch out for another Pokémon, passing any stat changes to the Pokémon that switches in. These effects are passed: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baton Pass turns into Z-Baton Pass and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
baton-pass.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baton Pass turns into Z-Baton Pass and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

beak-blast.Name: Beak Blast
beak-blast.Effects: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.
beak-blast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beak Blast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.

beat-up.Name: Beat Up
beat-up.Effects: Beat Up deals damage from each Pokémon on your team that does not have a status ailment (nor is fainted). Each strike has a different base power, calculated as: However, the actual attack is carried out by the original user of Beat Up, so it will always use that Pokémon's current attack stat to calculate damage. It will also receive any boosts from the originating user, such as STAB and any applicable items. However, any items held by the rest of the team do not affect the damage dealt. Each strike of Beat Up is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. Let's say we have the ultimate team of 1 Weavile and 5 Magikarp. One of the Magikarp is paralyzed, so only 4 can attack with Beat Up. Weavile's base Attack is 120, while Magikarp's is an incredible 10. Beat Up would attack 5 times, first with 17 base power (120 ÷ 10 + 5) and then 4 times with 6 base power (10 ÷ 10 + 5). The result would be as if Weavile had attacked with a Dark type move of 41 base power. In a more realistic scenario, the average total base power for Beat Up is typically around 60-90. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beat Up turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100
beat-up.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beat Up turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

behemoth-bash.Name: Behemoth Bash
behemoth-bash.Effects: Behemoth Bash deals damage, and if the target is Dynamaxed its power doubles to 200

behemoth-blade.Name: Behemoth Blade
behemoth-blade.Effects: Behemoth Blade deals damage, and if the target is Dynamaxed its power doubles to 200

belch.Name: Belch

belch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Belch turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.

belly-drum.Name: Belly Drum
belly-drum.Effects: User loses 50% of its max HP, but Attack raises to maximum.
belly-drum.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Belly Drum turns into Z-Belly Drum and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

bestow.Name: Bestow
bestow.Effects: Bestow gives the user's held item to the target. It will not work if the target is already holding an item or is behind a Substitute. Mail cannot be transferred. Items bestowed upon wild Pokémon are permanently lost if the Pokémon is KO'd, but items lost in Trainer battles are returned. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bestow turns into Z-Bestow and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above
bestow.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bestow turns into Z-Bestow and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

bide.Name: Bide
bide.Effects: The user of Bide stores energy for 2 turns. At the end of the second turn the Pokémon unleashes energy, dealing twice the HP damage it received. Bide deals fixed, typeless damage, so will hit Ghost-type Pokémon. It also ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats and can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. In double and triple battles, Bide hits the last Pokémon to attack the user (including teammates). When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bide turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
bide.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bide turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

bind.Name: Bind
bind.Effects: Bind inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
bind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

bite.Name: Bite
bite.Effects: Bite deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bite turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120
bite.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bite turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

blast-burn.Name: Blast Burn

blaze-kick.Name: Blaze Kick
blaze-kick.Effects: Blaze Kick deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blaze Kick turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160
blaze-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blaze Kick turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

bleakwind-storm.Name: Bleakwind Storm
bleakwind-storm.Effects: Bleakwind Storm deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Speed by one stage. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 30% chance of lowering Speed). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. If used during rain, Bleakwind Storm ignores accuracy

blizzard.Name: Blizzard
blizzard.Effects: Blizzard deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. It will hit both opponents in a double battle or adjacent opponents in a triple battle. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. During a hailstorm, Blizzard ignores accuracy. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blizzard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 185
blizzard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blizzard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 185.

bloom-doom.Name: Bloom Doom

If the target has used Minimize, Body Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Body Slam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
body-slam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Body Slam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

bolt-strike.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bolt Strike turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 195.

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bone Club turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 120
bone-club.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bone Club turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 120.

bone-rush.Name: Bone Rush
bone-rush.Effects: Bone Rush hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Bone Rush is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Bone Rush to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bone Rush turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140
bone-rush.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bone Rush turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140.

bonemerang.Name: Bonemerang
bonemerang.Effects: Bonemerang deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time). Each strike of Bonemerang is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bonemerang turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100
bonemerang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bonemerang turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

boomburst.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Boomburst turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

bounce.Name: Bounce
bounce.Effects: The user of Bounce will spring up on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Bounce deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Bounce executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bounce turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160
bounce.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bounce turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.
bounce.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

branch-poke.Name: Branch Poke

brave-bird.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Brave Bird turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 190.
