cotton-guard.Effects: Cotton Guard raises the user's Defense by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Cotton Guard would raise Defense to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level). When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Guard turns into Z-Cotton Guard and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
cotton-guard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Guard turns into Z-Cotton Guard and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

cotton-spore.Name: Cotton Spore
cotton-spore.Effects: Cotton Spore lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Spore turns into Z-Cotton Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
cotton-spore.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Spore turns into Z-Cotton Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

counter.Name: Counter
counter.Effects: When hit by a Physical Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.
counter.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Counter turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

court-change.Name: Court Change
court-change.Effects: Swaps the effects on either side of the field

covet.Name: Covet
covet.Effects: Covet deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not already holding an item. Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon, either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon, are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Covet turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120
covet.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Covet turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

crabhammer.Name: Crabhammer
crabhammer.Effects: Crabhammer deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crabhammer turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 180
crabhammer.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crabhammer turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 180.

crafty-shield.Name: Crafty Shield
crafty-shield.Effects: Crafty Shield protects the user's team from any Status category move targeted at them, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. It does not protect against the moves Perish Song, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Toxic Spikes, or Sticky Web; and it does not prevent moves that target the attacker itself (such as Rest). When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crafty Shield turns into Z-Crafty Shield and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
crafty-shield.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crafty Shield turns into Z-Crafty Shield and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
crafty-shield.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

cross-chop.Name: Cross Chop
cross-chop.Effects: Cross Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180
cross-chop.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

cross-poison.Name: Cross Poison
cross-poison.Effects: Cross Poison deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Poison turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 140
cross-poison.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Poison turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 140.

crunch.Name: Crunch
crunch.Effects: Crunch deals damage and has a 20% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crunch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160
crunch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crunch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

crush-claw.Name: Crush Claw
crush-claw.Effects: Crush Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Claw turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140
crush-claw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Claw turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

crush-grip.Name: Crush Grip
crush-grip.Effects: Crush Grip inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is: Crush Grip is a Physical-category counterpart move to Wring Out. It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption, based on the opponent rather than the user. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
crush-grip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

curse.Name: Curse
curse.Effects: Curse is a unique move that works differently for Ghost-type Pokémon than other Pokémon. Ghost-type Pokémon use 50% of their maximum HP to place a curse on the target. The cursed Pokémon loses 25% of their maximum HP every turn. If the user has less than 50% HP remaining, they will faint but the curse still takes effect. For all other Pokémon, Curse raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each and lowers Speed by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Curse turns into Z-Curse and either fully restores the user's HP if it is Ghost type, or raises Attack one stage otherwise, in addition to its usual effect as above
curse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Curse turns into Z-Curse and either fully restores the user's HP if it is Ghost type, or raises Attack one stage otherwise, in addition to its usual effect as above.

cut.Name: Cut
cut.Effects:
Cut deals damage with no additional effect in battle. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cut turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Cut is used to tear down small trees in your path. In Generations 1-6 it can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
In Generations 1-3, Cut can also remove patches of grass. In Emerald, Pokémon with the Hyper Cutter ability remove a larger patch of grass
cut.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cut turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Cut is used to tear down small trees in your path. In Generations 1-6 it can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
In Generations 1-3, Cut can also remove patches of grass. In Emerald, Pokémon with the Hyper Cutter ability remove a larger patch of grass.

dark-pulse.Name: Dark Pulse
dark-pulse.Effects: Dark Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Pulse turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160
dark-pulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Pulse turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
dark-pulse.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

dark-void.Name: Dark Void
dark-void.Effects: Dark Void puts the target(s) to sleep. It can only be used by Darkrai. It targets all adjacent opponents i.e. the opposing Pokémon in a single battle, both opponents in a double battle, three opponents if in the center of a triple battle, or two opponents if situated at the side in a triple battle. Each target is counted as a separate attack so it may succeed for all, any or none of the targets. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Void turns into Z-Dark Void and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
dark-void.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Void turns into Z-Dark Void and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

darkest-lariat.Name: Darkest Lariat
darkest-lariat.Effects: Darkest Lariat deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.When Incineroar is holding Incinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Malicious Moonsault and has base power 180
darkest-lariat.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.When Incineroar is holding Incinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Malicious Moonsault and has base power 180.

dazzling-gleam.Name: Dazzling Gleam
dazzling-gleam.Effects: Dazzling Gleam deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dazzling Gleam turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 160
dazzling-gleam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dazzling Gleam turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 160.

decorate.Name: Decorate
decorate.Effects: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack.							(100% chance

defend-order.Name: Defend Order
defend-order.Effects: Defend Order raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defend Order turns into Z-Defend Order and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
defend-order.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defend Order turns into Z-Defend Order and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

defense-curl.Name: Defense Curl
defense-curl.Effects: Defense Curl raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. After Defense Curl has been used at least once and while the user stays in battle, the power of Rollout and Ice Ball is double their regular base power. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defense Curl turns into Z-Defense Curl and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
defense-curl.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defense Curl turns into Z-Defense Curl and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

defog.Name: Defog
defog.Effects:
Defog lowers the target's Evasion by one stage and removes entry hazards and barriers on both sides of the field. The moves affected are: Light Screen, Reflect, Mist, Safeguard, Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web and Toxic Spikes. Defog also clears foggy weather in battle (which causes Accuracy loss when present), however this weather condition is only present in Sinnoh (Diamond/Pearl/Platinum) and cannot be created in battle otherwise. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defog turns into Z-Defog and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
Defog can be used to clear foggy areas (fog will return upon leaving and re-entering the area). So far only Sinnoh has experienced foggy weather. In Diamond & Pearl, Defog cannot be used outside of battle before obtaining the Fen Badge (Pastoria City Gym); In Platinum it cannot be used before the Relic Badge (Hearthome City Gym)
defog.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defog turns into Z-Defog and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
Defog can be used to clear foggy areas (fog will return upon leaving and re-entering the area). So far only Sinnoh has experienced foggy weather. In Diamond & Pearl, Defog cannot be used outside of battle before obtaining the Fen Badge (Pastoria City Gym); In Platinum it cannot be used before the Relic Badge (Hearthome City Gym).

destiny-bond.Name: Destiny Bond
destiny-bond.Effects: If the user faints, the opponent also faints.
destiny-bond.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Destiny Bond turns into Z-Destiny Bond and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.

detect.Name: Detect
detect.Effects: Detect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Protect. The accuracy of Detect drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Detect but deal 1⁄4 of the damage. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Detect turns into Z-Detect and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
detect.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Detect turns into Z-Detect and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

devastating-drake.Name: Devastating Drake
devastating-drake.Effects: Devastating Drake is the Dragon type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

diamond-storm.Name: Diamond Storm
diamond-storm.Effects: Diamond Storm deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Diamond Storm turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180
diamond-storm.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Diamond Storm turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.

dig.Name: Dig
dig.Effects:
The user of Dig will burrow its way underground on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dig deals damage. While underground, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Earthquake, Magnitude or Fissure, with Earthquake and Magnitude dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underground. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dig executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dig turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
Dig can be used to escape from caves. The player is returned to the location at which they entered, just like using an Escape Rope
dig.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dig turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
Dig can be used to escape from caves. The player is returned to the location at which they entered, just like using an Escape Rope.

dire-claw.Name: Dire Claw
dire-claw.Effects: Dire Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of either poisoning, paralyzing, or putting the target to sleep. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep

disable.Name: Disable
disable.Effects: Disable causes the previous move the target used to be disabled for 1-8 turns, which prevents the move's use. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disable turns into Z-Disable and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
disable.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disable turns into Z-Disable and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

disarming-voice.Name: Disarming Voice
disarming-voice.Effects: Disarming Voice deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disarming Voice turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100
disarming-voice.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disarming Voice turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.

discharge.Name: Discharge
discharge.Effects: Discharge deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target(s). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Discharge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160
discharge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Discharge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

dive.Name: Dive
dive.Effects:
The user of Dive will hide underwater on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dive deals damage. While underwater, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Surf, Whirlpool or Low Kick, with Surf and Whirlpool dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underwater. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Dive executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dive turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
While surfing, if you happen over a dark patch of water, you can dive below the surface and explore underwater. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
Two regions have areas where you can use Dive: Hoenn (Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, and the remakes Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire) and Unova (Black, White, Black 2, White 2) and the move is an HM in those games
dive.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dive turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
While surfing, if you happen over a dark patch of water, you can dive below the surface and explore underwater. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
Two regions have areas where you can use Dive: Hoenn (Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, and the remakes Omega Ruby & Alpha Sapphire) and Unova (Black, White, Black 2, White 2) and the move is an HM in those games.

dizzy-punch.Name: Dizzy Punch
dizzy-punch.Effects: Dizzy Punch deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dizzy Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140
dizzy-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dizzy Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

doodle.Name: Doodle
doodle.Effects: Changes the abilities of the user and its teammates to that of the target

doom-desire.Name: Doom Desire
doom-desire.Effects: Two turns after the move is selected, Doom Desire will deal damage. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the damage dealt will depend on the Special Defense of the Pokémon the move hits, not the Pokémon it was originally targeted at. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Doom Desire turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 200
doom-desire.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Doom Desire turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 200.

double-hit.Name: Double Hit
double-hit.Effects: Double Hit deals damage and will strike twice (with 35 base power each time). Each strike of Double Hit is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Hit turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140
double-hit.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Hit turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

double-iron-bash.Name: Double Iron
double-iron-bash.Effects: Double Iron Bash deals damage, will strike twice (with 60 base power each time), and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch

double-kick.Name: Double Kick
double-kick.Effects: Double Kick deals damage and will strike twice (with 30 base power each time). Each strike of Double Kick is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100
double-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

double-shock.Name: Double Shock
double-shock.Effects: After using this move, the user will no longer be Electric type

double-slap.Name: Double Slap
double-slap.Effects: Double Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Double Slap is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Double Slap to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
double-slap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

double-team.Name: Double Team
double-team.Effects: Double Team raises the user's Evasiveness by one stage, thus making the user more difficult to hit. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Team turns into Z-Double Team and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
double-team.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Team turns into Z-Double Team and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

double-edge.Name: Double-Edge
double-edge.Effects: Double-Edge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double-Edge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
double-edge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double-Edge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

draco-meteor.Name: Draco Meteor
draco-meteor.Effects: Draco Meteor deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draco Meteor turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 195
draco-meteor.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draco Meteor turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 195.

dragon-ascent.Name: Dragon Ascent
dragon-ascent.Effects: Dragon Ascent deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking. It is the signature move of Rayquaza, and once learned allows Rayquaza to Mega-Evolve. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Ascent turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 190
dragon-ascent.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Ascent turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 190.

dragon-breath.Name: Dragon Breath
dragon-breath.Effects: Dragon Breath deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Breath turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 120
dragon-breath.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Breath turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 120.

dragon-cheer.Name: Dragon Cheer
dragon-cheer.Effects: The user raises its allies’ morale with a draconic cry so that their future attacks have a heightened chance of landing critical hits. This rouses Dragon types more

dragon-claw.Name: Dragon Claw
dragon-claw.Effects: Dragon Claw deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Claw turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160
dragon-claw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Claw turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160.

dragon-dance.Name: Dragon Dance
dragon-dance.Effects: Dragon Dance raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Dance turns into Z-Dragon Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
dragon-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Dance turns into Z-Dragon Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

dragon-darts.Name: Dragon Darts
dragon-darts.Effects: Dragon Darts deals damage and hits twice. In a double battle, it hits each opponent once. Dragon Darts is the signature move of Dragapult

dragon-energy.Name: Dragon Energy
dragon-energy.Effects: The higher the user's HP, the higher the power

dragon-hammer.Name: Dragon Hammer
dragon-hammer.Effects: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.
dragon-hammer.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Hammer turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 175.

dragon-pulse.Name: Dragon Pulse
dragon-pulse.Effects: Dragon Pulse deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Pulse turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160
dragon-pulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Pulse turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160.
dragon-pulse.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

dragon-rage.Name: Dragon Rage
dragon-rage.Effects: Dragon Rage always deals 40 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing. It has no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100
dragon-rage.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.

dragon-rush.Name: Dragon Rush
dragon-rush.Effects: Dragon Rush deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. If the target has used Minimize, Dragon Rush ignores accuracy and deals double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rush turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 180
dragon-rush.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rush turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 180.

dragon-tail.Name: Dragon Tail
dragon-tail.Effects: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.
dragon-tail.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Tail turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 120.

drain-punch.Name: Drain Punch
drain-punch.Effects: Drain Punch deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drain Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140
drain-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drain Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

draining-kiss.Name: Draining Kiss
draining-kiss.Effects: Draining Kiss deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draining Kiss turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100
draining-kiss.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draining Kiss turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.

dream-eater.Name: Dream Eater
dream-eater.Effects: Dream Eater deals damage only on sleeping foes and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dream Eater turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180
dream-eater.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dream Eater turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.

drill-peck.Name: Drill Peck
drill-peck.Effects: Drill Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Peck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160
drill-peck.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Peck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.
drill-peck.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

drill-run.Name: Drill Run
drill-run.Effects: Drill Run deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Run turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160
drill-run.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Run turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160.

dual-chop.Name: Dual Chop
dual-chop.Effects: Dual Chop deals damage and will strike twice (with 40 base power each time). Each strike of Dual Chop is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dual Chop turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100
dual-chop.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dual Chop turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.

dual-wingbeat.Name: Dual Wingbeat
dual-wingbeat.Effects: The user slams the target with its wings. The target is hit twice in a row. Dual Wingbeat is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

dynamax-cannon.Name: Dynamax Cannon
dynamax-cannon.Effects: Damage doubles if opponent is Dynamaxed

dynamic-punch.Name: Dynamic Punch
dynamic-punch.Effects: Dynamic Punch deals damage and confuses the target, if it hits. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dynamic Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180
dynamic-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dynamic Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

earth-power.Name: Earth Power
earth-power.Effects: Earth Power deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earth Power turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175
earth-power.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earth Power turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.

earthquake.Name: Earthquake
earthquake.Effects: Earthquake deals damage, and will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earthquake turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180
earthquake.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earthquake turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.

echoed-voice.Name: Echoed Voice
echoed-voice.Effects: Echoed Voice deals damage starting at base power 40, and increases by 40 each turn if used by any Pokémon on the field, up to a maximum base power of 200. It does not reset if it misses, as long as the move is attempted each turn. The power does not increase during a turn (if multiple Pokémon use it), only after each turn. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Echoed Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
echoed-voice.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Echoed Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

eerie-impulse.Name: Eerie Impulse
eerie-impulse.Effects: Eerie Impulse lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eerie Impulse turns into Z-Eerie Impulse and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
eerie-impulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eerie Impulse turns into Z-Eerie Impulse and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

eerie-spell.Name: Eerie Spell
eerie-spell.Effects: Eerie Spell deals damage and reduces the PP of the target's last-used move by 3

egg-bomb.Name: Egg Bomb
egg-bomb.Effects: Egg Bomb deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Egg Bomb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180
egg-bomb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Egg Bomb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

electric-terrain.Name: Electric Terrain
electric-terrain.Effects: Electric Terrain creates a low-lying electric field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep. The power of Electric type moves also increases by 50% while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Electric Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Thunderbolt under Electric Terrain. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electric Terrain turns into Z-Electric Terrain and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
electric-terrain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electric Terrain turns into Z-Electric Terrain and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

electrify.Name: Electrify
electrify.Effects: Electrify causes the target's move to become Electric type, if it has yet to attack during that turn. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electrify turns into Z-Electrify and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
electrify.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electrify turns into Z-Electrify and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

electro-ball.Name: Electro Ball
electro-ball.Effects: Electro Ball inflicts more damage the faster the user is compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = UserSpeed ÷ TargetSpeed For example, if the user's Speed is at least 3 times more than the target but less than 4 times, Electro Ball hits with 120 base power. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electro Ball turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160
electro-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electro Ball turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

electro-drift.Name: Electro Drift
electro-drift.Effects: Boosted even more if it's super-effective

electro-shot.Name: Electro Shot
electro-shot.Effects: The user absorbs electricity on the first turn and raises its Special Attack; on the second turn, Electro Shot deals damage. During rain, Electro Shot executes in one turn

electroweb.Name: Electroweb
electroweb.Effects: Electroweb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electroweb turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100
electroweb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electroweb turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

embargo.Name: Embargo
embargo.Effects: Embargo prevents the target using any items for five turns. This includes both held items and items used by the trainer such as medicines. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Embargo turns into Z-Embargo and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
embargo.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Embargo turns into Z-Embargo and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

ember.Name: Ember
ember.Effects: Ember deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ember turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100
ember.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ember turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.

encore.Name: Encore
encore.Effects: Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns. Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Encore turns into Z-Encore and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
encore.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Encore turns into Z-Encore and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

endeavor.Name: Endeavor
endeavor.Effects: Endeavor reduces the opponent's HP to equal the user's. (It fails if the user's HP is higher than the target's.) When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endeavor turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
endeavor.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endeavor turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

endure.Name: Endure
endure.Effects: Endure allows the user to survive all attacks during the turn with at least 1 HP (even if it already has 1 HP remaining). It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Endure decreases by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endure turns into Z-Endure and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
endure.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endure turns into Z-Endure and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

energy-ball.Name: Energy Ball
energy-ball.Effects: Energy Ball deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Energy Ball turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175
energy-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Energy Ball turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.

entrainment.Name: Entrainment
entrainment.Effects: Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's. It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant, Multitype or Zen Mode. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Entrainment turns into Z-Entrainment and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
entrainment.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Entrainment turns into Z-Entrainment and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

eruption.Name: Eruption
eruption.Effects: Eruption inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is: Eruption is a counterpart move to Water Spout. It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out, based on the user rather than the opponent. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eruption turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200
eruption.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eruption turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

esper-wing.Name: Esper Wing
esper-wing.Effects: Esper Wing deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

eternabeam.Name: Eternabeam
eternabeam.Effects: User can't move on the next turn

expanding-force.Name: Expanding Force
expanding-force.Effects: The user attacks the target with its psychic power. This move’s power goes up and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain. Expanding Force is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

explosion.Name: Explosion
explosion.Effects: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Explosion turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200
explosion.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Explosion turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

extrasensory.Name: Extrasensory
extrasensory.Effects: Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extrasensory turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160
extrasensory.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extrasensory turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

extreme-evoboost.Name: Extreme Evoboost
extreme-evoboost.Effects: Extreme Evoboost is a Z-Move exclusive to Eevee. It is used with Last Resort. Extreme Evoboost raises all the user's stats (Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, Speed) by two stages each

extreme-speed.Name: Extreme Speed
extreme-speed.Effects: Extreme Speed deals damage and attacks before the majority of other moves (priority of +2). When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extreme Speed turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
extreme-speed.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extreme Speed turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

facade.Name: Facade
facade.Effects: Facade deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the user is burned, poisoned or paralyzed. In the case of a burn, the usual attack-halving still occurs so Facade hits with an effective power of 70. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Facade turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140
facade.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Facade turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

fairy-lock.Name: Fairy Lock
fairy-lock.Effects: Fairy Lock prevents all Pokémon on the field from fleeing during the following turn. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Lock turns into Z-Fairy Lock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
fairy-lock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Lock turns into Z-Fairy Lock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

fairy-wind.Name: Fairy Wind
fairy-wind.Effects: Fairy Wind deals damage with no added effects. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Wind turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100
fairy-wind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fairy Wind turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.

fake-out.Name: Fake Out
fake-out.Effects: Fake Out attacks with a priority of +3 and causes the target to flinch if it hits. It is only successful on the first turn the Pokémon is in battle, but reset each time the Pokémon switches out and back in. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
fake-out.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

fake-tears.Name: Fake Tears
fake-tears.Effects: Fake Tears lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Tears turns into Z-Fake Tears and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
fake-tears.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fake Tears turns into Z-Fake Tears and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

false-swipe.Name: False Swipe
false-swipe.Effects: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
false-swipe.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, False Swipe turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

feather-dance.Name: Feather Dance
feather-dance.Effects: Feather Dance lowers the target's Attack by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feather Dance turns into Z-Feather Dance and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
feather-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feather Dance turns into Z-Feather Dance and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

feint.Name: Feint
feint.Effects: Feint only hits if the target used Protect or Detect in the same turn. It also cancels Protect/Detect for the remainder of the turn, so subsequent moves in the same turn (in double/triple battles) can still hit. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
feint.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

feint-attack.Name: Feint Attack
feint-attack.Effects: Feint Attack deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint Attack turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120
feint-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Feint Attack turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

fell-stinger.Name: Fell Stinger
fell-stinger.Effects: Fell Stinger deals damage, and if the target is knocked out by this move, the user's Attack is raised by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fell Stinger turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100
fell-stinger.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fell Stinger turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

fickle-beam.Name: Fickle Beam
fickle-beam.Effects: Fickle Beam deals damage with 80 base power, however there is a 30% chance for the power to double to 160

fiery-dance.Name: Fiery Dance
fiery-dance.Effects: Fiery Dance deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fiery Dance turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160
fiery-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fiery Dance turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

fillet-away.Name: Fillet Away
fillet-away.Effects: Lowers HP but sharply boosts Attack, Special Attack, and Speed

final-gambit.Name: Final Gambit
final-gambit.Effects: Inflicts damage equal to the user's remaining HP. User faints.
final-gambit.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Final Gambit turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

fire-blast.Name: Fire Blast
fire-blast.Effects: Fire Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Blast turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 185
fire-blast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Blast turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 185.

fire-fang.Name: Fire Fang
fire-fang.Effects: Fire Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of burning the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Fang turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120
fire-fang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Fang turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.

fire-lash.Name: Fire Lash
fire-lash.Effects: The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target's Defense stat.							(100% chance)
fire-lash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Lash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

fire-pledge.Name: Fire Pledge
fire-pledge.Effects: Fire Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Fire Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Fire Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Pledge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160
fire-pledge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Pledge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

fire-punch.Name: Fire Punch
fire-punch.Effects: Fire Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Punch turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140
fire-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Punch turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.

fire-spin.Name: Fire Spin
fire-spin.Effects: Fire Spin inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Spin turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100
fire-spin.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fire Spin turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.

first-impression.Name: First Impression
first-impression.Effects: Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle.
first-impression.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, First Impression turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.

fishious-rend.Name: Fishious Rend
fishious-rend.Effects: If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled

fissure.Name: Fissure
fissure.Effects: If it hits, Fissure is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers: This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Fissure has 30% accuracy. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fissure turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180
fissure.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fissure turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.

flail.Name: Flail
flail.Effects: Flail deals more damage the lower the user's HP. The following formula is used: The value of N is then used to determine the base power, as per the table below. It converts to some quite specific percentages which are also shown. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flail turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
flail.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flail turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

flame-burst.Name: Flame Burst
flame-burst.Effects: Flame Burst deals damage and will also cause splash damage to any Pokémon adjacent to the target (including the user if Flame Burst is targeted at an ally). The splash damage caused to a Pokémon is 1⁄16 of its maximum HP. It is typeless and not counted as regular damage but treated similarly to weather damage, which means that: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Burst turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140
flame-burst.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Burst turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.

flame-charge.Name: Flame Charge
flame-charge.Effects: Flame Charge deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Charge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100
flame-charge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Charge turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.

flame-wheel.Name: Flame Wheel
flame-wheel.Effects: Flame Wheel deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flame Wheel can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Wheel turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120
flame-wheel.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flame Wheel turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.

flamethrower.Name: Flamethrower
flamethrower.Effects: Flamethrower deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flamethrower turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175
flamethrower.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flamethrower turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175.

flare-blitz.Name: Flare Blitz
flare-blitz.Effects: Flare Blitz deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Flare Blitz can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flare Blitz turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 190
flare-blitz.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flare Blitz turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 190.

flash.Name: Flash
flash.Effects:
Flash lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash turns into Z-Flash and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
Flash lights up dark caves. In the original games dark caves made the screen almost completely black, whereas in later games you can always see a very short distance around you; Flash merely expands that circle. In the games it is an HM, it can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge
flash.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash turns into Z-Flash and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
Flash lights up dark caves. In the original games dark caves made the screen almost completely black, whereas in later games you can always see a very short distance around you; Flash merely expands that circle. In the games it is an HM, it can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.

flash-cannon.Name: Flash Cannon
flash-cannon.Effects: Flash Cannon deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash Cannon turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160
flash-cannon.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flash Cannon turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

flatter.Name: Flatter
flatter.Effects: Flatter confuses the target, and raises its Special Attack by one stage. If one of the two effects cannot be invoked (for example the target is already confused or its Special Attack already raised to the maximum of +6 stages), Flatter still works and will invoke the other effect. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flatter turns into Z-Flatter and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
flatter.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flatter turns into Z-Flatter and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

fleur-cannon.Name: Fleur Cannon
fleur-cannon.Effects: Fleur Cannon  deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fleur Cannon turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 195
fleur-cannon.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fleur Cannon turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 195.

fling.Name: Fling
fling.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fling turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

flip-turn.Name: Flip Turn
flip-turn.Effects: After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting. Flip Turn  is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

floaty-fall.Name: Floaty Fall
floaty-fall.Effects: Floaty Fall deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Floaty Fall is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Zippy Zap and Splishy Splash

floral-healing.Name: Floral Healing
floral-healing.Effects: The user restores the target's HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass.
floral-healing.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Floral Healing turns into Z-Floral Healing and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

flower-shield.Name: Flower Shield
flower-shield.Effects: Flower Shield raises the Defense of all Grass-type Pokémon in battle (including opponents) by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flower Shield turns into Z-Flower Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
flower-shield.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flower Shield turns into Z-Flower Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

flower-trick.Name: Flower Trick
flower-trick.Effects: Never misses; always results in a critical hit

fly.Name: Fly
fly.Effects:
The user of Fly will fly up high on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Fly deals damage. While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust, Twister, Thunder, Sky Uppercut and Smack Down, with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Fly executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fly turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Fly allows you to fly instantly to any PokéCenter you have already visited during the course of the game (or certain other prominent locations). It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge
fly.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fly turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Fly allows you to fly instantly to any PokéCenter you have already visited during the course of the game (or certain other prominent locations). It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
fly.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

flying-press.Name: Flying Press
flying-press.Effects:
Flying Press deals damage. It is a Fighting type move, but deals a combination of Fighting and Flying type damage. This in effect gives the move its own type chart, as shown below. NorFirWatEleGraIceFigPoiGroFlyPsyBugRocGhoDraDarSteFai
2½222½½½02½ Although Flying Press deals dual type damage, it is still a pure Fighting type move so only gains STAB from Fighting type Pokémon. If the target has used Minimize, Flying Press ignores accuracy and deals double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flying Press turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 170
flying-press.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Flying Press turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 170.

focus-blast.Name: Focus Blast
focus-blast.Effects: Focus Blast deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Blast turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190
focus-blast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Blast turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.

focus-energy.Name: Focus Energy
focus-energy.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Energy turns into Z-Focus Energy and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

focus-punch.Name: Focus Punch
focus-punch.Effects: The user of Focus Punch will tighten its focus before any other moves are made. If any regular move (with a higher priority than -3) directly hits the focused Pokémon, it loses its focus and flinches, not carrying out the attack. If no direct hits are made, Focus Punch attacks as normal. Moves of lower priority than Focus Punch - for example Avalanche or Dragon Tail - will not cause the user to lose focus. The user will tighten their focus, Focus Punch will attack, then the opponent will use their lower priority move (and in the case of Avalanche, hit with double power). When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 200
focus-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Focus Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 200.

follow-me.Name: Follow Me
follow-me.Effects: In Double Battle, the user takes all the attacks. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Follow Me turns into Z-Follow Me and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
follow-me.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Follow Me turns into Z-Follow Me and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

force-palm.Name: Force Palm
force-palm.Effects: Force Palm deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Force Palm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120
force-palm.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Force Palm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

foresight.Name: Foresight
foresight.Effects:
Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.					
					Changes

In Generations 2-3, Foresight has 100% accuracy.
foresight.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foresight turns into Z-Foresight and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

forests-curse.Name: Forest's Curse
forests-curse.Effects: Forest's Curse adds the Grass type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon. It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Grass. If the target is under the effect of Trick-or-Treat the Ghost type is replaced by Grass. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Forest's Curse turns into Z-Forest's Curse and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above
forests-curse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Forest's Curse turns into Z-Forest's Curse and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

foul-play.Name: Foul Play
foul-play.Effects: Foul Play uses the opponent's Attack stat instead of the user's in damage calculation. In other words, the move acts as if the target is attacking themselves, and thus is more powerful when the opponent has higher Attack. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foul Play turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 175
foul-play.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Foul Play turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 175.

freeze-shock.Name: Freeze Shock
freeze-shock.Effects: The user of Freeze Shock will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Freeze Shock executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze Shock turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200
freeze-shock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze Shock turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.

freeze-dry.Name: Freeze-Dry
freeze-dry.Effects:
Freeze-Dry deals damage and has a 10% change of freezing the target. In addition to Ice's usual type advantages, Freeze-Dry is also super-effective against the Water type. This in effect gives the move its own (slightly different) type chart, as shown below: NorFirWatEleGraIceFigPoiGroFlyPsyBugRocGhoDraDarSteFai
½22½222½ When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze-Dry turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140
freeze-dry.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Freeze-Dry turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.

freezy-frost.Name: Freezy Frost
freezy-frost.Effects: Freezy Frost deals damage and eliminates stat changes from all Pokémon on the field (similar to Haze). Freezy Frost is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, and Sparkly Swirl

frenzy-plant.Name: Frenzy Plant
frenzy-plant.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frenzy Plant turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 200.

frost-breath.Name: Frost Breath
frost-breath.Effects: Frost Breath deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Frost Breath will hit them with base power 60. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frost Breath turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120
frost-breath.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frost Breath turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

frustration.Name: Frustration
frustration.Effects: The power of Frustration is higher when the Pokémon likes its trainer less. The base power varies between 1 (maximum Friendship) and 102 (minimum Friendship). The exact formula is: Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details). Frustration is the counterpart move to Return. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frustration turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
frustration.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Frustration turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

fury-attack.Name: Fury Attack
fury-attack.Effects: Fury Attack hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Fury Attack is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Fury Attack to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
fury-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

fury-cutter.Name: Fury Cutter
fury-cutter.Effects: Fury Cutter deals damage starting at base power 40, and for each successful consecutive hit doubles in power, up to a maximum base power of 160. If the move misses for any reason, the base power resets to 40. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Cutter turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100
fury-cutter.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Cutter turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

fury-swipes.Name: Fury Swipes
fury-swipes.Effects: Fury Swipes hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Fury Swipes is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Fury Swipes to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Swipes turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
fury-swipes.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fury Swipes turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

fusion-bolt.Name: Fusion Bolt
fusion-bolt.Effects: Fusion Bolt deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Flare has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Bolt's animation will change to look more epic. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Bolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180
fusion-bolt.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Bolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180.

fusion-flare.Name: Fusion Flare
fusion-flare.Effects: Fusion Flare deals damage, and its power doubles to 200 if Fusion Bolt has been used before it in the same turn. If this happens Fusion Flare's animation will change to look more epic. If the user is frozen, Fusion Flare can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Flare turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180
fusion-flare.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Fusion Flare turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

future-sight.Name: Future Sight
future-sight.Effects: Future Sight deals damage, but does not hit until two turns after the move is used. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the new Pokémon gets hit, with their type and stats taken into account. Future Sight cannot be stopped by Protect, Detect, Endure or the Wonder Guard ability. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Future Sight turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190
future-sight.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Future Sight turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.

g-max-befuddle.Name: G-Max Befuddle
g-max-befuddle.Effects: G-Max Befuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Butterfree. Bug type moves turn into G-Max Befuddle during Gigantamax. G-Max Befuddle deals damage and causes poison, paralysis or sleep to each opponent
g-max-befuddle.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-cannonade.Name: G-Max Cannonade
g-max-cannonade.Effects: G-Max Cannonade is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Blastoise. Water type moves turn into G-Max Cannonade during Gigantamax. G-Max Cannonade deals damage and causes all non-Water type opponents to lose 1⁄6 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4 turns
g-max-cannonade.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-centiferno.Name: G-Max Centiferno
g-max-centiferno.Effects: G-Max Centiferno is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Centiskorch. Fire type moves turn into G-Max Centiferno during Gigantamax. G-Max Centiferno deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Fire Spin
g-max-centiferno.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-chi-strike.Name: G-Max Chi
g-max-chi-strike.Effects: G-Max Chi Strike is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Machamp. Fighting type moves turn into G-Max Chi Strike during Gigantamax. G-Max Chi Strike deals damage and increases the user's critical hit ratio
g-max-chi-strike.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-cuddle.Name: G-Max Cuddle
g-max-cuddle.Effects: G-Max Cuddle is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Eevee. Normal type moves turn into G-Max Cuddle during Gigantamax. G-Max Cuddle deals damage and infatuates all opposite-gender opponents
g-max-cuddle.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
