g-max-depletion.Effects: G-Max Depletion is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Duraludon. Dragon type moves turn into G-Max Depletion during Gigantamax. G-Max Depletion deals damage and reduces the PP of the last move used
g-max-depletion.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-drum-solo.Name: G-Max Drum
g-max-drum-solo.Effects: G-Max Drum Solo is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Rillaboom. Grass type moves turn into G-Max Drum Solo during Gigantamax. G-Max Drum Solo deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160, regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves
g-max-drum-solo.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-finale.Name: G-Max Finale
g-max-finale.Effects: G-Max Finale is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Alcremie. Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Finale during Gigantamax. G-Max Finale deals damage and heals Pokémon on the user's side of the field
g-max-finale.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-fireball.Name: G-Max Fireball
g-max-fireball.Effects: G-Max Fireball is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Cinderace. Fire type moves turn into G-Max Fireball during Gigantamax. G-Max Fireball deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160, regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves
g-max-fireball.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-foam-burst.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-gold-rush.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-gravitas.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

G-Max Hydrosnipe deals damage and ignores all effects of the target's Ability. Its base power is always 160, regardless of the original move selected, but it matches the original category (Physical or Special), like Max Moves
g-max-hydrosnipe.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-malodor.Name: G-Max Malodor
g-max-malodor.Effects: G-Max Malodor is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Garbodor. Poison type moves turn into G-Max Malodor during Gigantamax. G-Max Malodor deals damage and poisons opponents
g-max-malodor.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-meltdown.Name: G-Max Meltdown
g-max-meltdown.Effects: G-Max Meltdown is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Melmetal. Steel type moves turn into G-Max Meltdown during Gigantamax. G-Max Meltdown deals damage and prevents opponents using the same move twice in a row, like Torment
g-max-meltdown.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-one-blow.Name: G-Max One
g-max-one-blow.Effects: G-Max One Blow is a G-Max Move from the Pokemon Sword and Shield Expansion Pass, exclusive to Urshifu (Single Strike Style). Dark type moves turn into G-Max One Blow during Gigantamax. G-Max One Blow deals damage and can hit through Max Guard and any Protect-like move
g-max-one-blow.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-rapid-flow.Name: G-Max Rapid

g-max-rapid-flow.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-replenish.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-resonance.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-sandblast.Name: G-Max Sandblast
g-max-sandblast.Effects: G-Max Sandblast is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Sandaconda. Ground type moves turn into G-Max Sandblast during Gigantamax. G-Max Sandblast deals damage and traps opponents, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns, like the move Sand Tomb
g-max-sandblast.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-smite.Effects: G-Max Smite is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Hatterene. Fairy type moves turn into G-Max Smite during Gigantamax. G-Max Smite deals damage and confuses all opponents
g-max-smite.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-snooze.Effects: G-Max Snooze is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Grimmsnarl. Dark type moves turn into G-Max Snooze during Gigantamax. G-Max Snooze deals damage and makes the opponents drowsy. They will fall asleep on the next turn if not switched out, like the move Yawn
g-max-snooze.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-steelsurge.Name: G-Max Steelsurge
g-max-steelsurge.Effects: G-Max Steelsurge is a G-Max Move from Pokémon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Copperajah. Steel type moves turn into G-Max Steelsurge during Gigantamax. G-Max Steelsurge deals damage and scatters spikes around the opponents which hurts Pokémon switching in, like the move Spikes
g-max-steelsurge.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-stonesurge.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-sweetness.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-tartness.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-terror.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-volt-crash.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-wildfire.Name: G-Max Wildfire
g-max-wildfire.Effects: G-Max Wildfire is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Charizard. Fire type moves turn into G-Max Wildfire during Gigantamax. G-Max Wildfire deals damage and causes all non-Fire type opponents to lose 1⁄6 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4 turns
g-max-wildfire.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

g-max-wind-rage.Name: G-Max Wind
g-max-wind-rage.Effects: G-Max Wind Rage is a G-Max Move from Pokemon Sword and Shield, exclusive to Corviknight. Flying type moves turn into G-Max Wind Rage during Gigantamax. G-Max Wind Rage removes the effects of all battlefield hazards, including Reflect, Light Screen, Spikes, and Terrain conditions
g-max-wind-rage.Target: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.

gastro-acid.Name: Gastro Acid
gastro-acid.Effects: Cancels out the effect of the opponent's Ability.
gastro-acid.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gastro Acid turns into Z-Gastro Acid and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

gear-grind.Name: Gear Grind
gear-grind.Effects: Gear Grind deals damage and will strike twice (with 50 base power each time). Each strike of Gear Grind is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Grind turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180
gear-grind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Grind turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.

gear-up.Name: Gear Up
gear-up.Effects: The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability.
gear-up.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gear Up turns into Z-Gear Up and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
gear-up.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

genesis-supernova.Name: Genesis Supernova
genesis-supernova.Effects: Genesis Supernova is a Psychic type Z-move exclusive to Mew. It is used with the move Psychic

geomancy.Name: Geomancy
geomancy.Effects: Geomancy charges on the first turn. On the second turn it raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by two stages each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Geomancy is the signature move of Xerneas. In battle, rainbow-colored light erupts from the ground around the user. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Geomancy turns into Z-Geomancy and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above
geomancy.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Geomancy turns into Z-Geomancy and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

giga-drain.Name: Giga Drain
giga-drain.Effects: Giga Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Drain turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140
giga-drain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Drain turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.

giga-impact.Name: Giga Impact
giga-impact.Effects: Giga Impact deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Giga Impact is the Physical counterpart to Hyper Beam. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Impact turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.When Snorlax is holding Snorlium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Impact turns into Pulverizing Pancake and has base power 210
giga-impact.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Impact turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.When Snorlax is holding Snorlium Z and uses its Z-Power, Giga Impact turns into Pulverizing Pancake and has base power 210.

gigaton-hammer.Name: Gigaton Hammer
gigaton-hammer.Effects: Cannot be used twice in a row

gigavolt-havoc.Name: Gigavolt Havoc
gigavolt-havoc.Effects: Gigavolt Havoc is the Electric type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

glacial-lance.Name: Glacial Lance
glacial-lance.Effects:
The user attacks by hurling a blizzard-cloaked icicle lance at opposing Pokémon.					
					Changes

In Pokémon Legends: Arceus, Glacial Lance has 130 base power

glaciate.Name: Glaciate
glaciate.Effects: Glaciate deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glaciate turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120
glaciate.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glaciate turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

glaive-rush.Name: Glaive Rush
glaive-rush.Effects: Attacks from opposing Pokémon during the next turn cannot miss and will inflict double damage

glare.Name: Glare
glare.Effects: Glare paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glare turns into Z-Glare and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
glare.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Glare turns into Z-Glare and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

glitzy-glow.Name: Glitzy Glow
glitzy-glow.Effects: Glitzy Glow deals damage and reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Light Screen). Glitzy Glow is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl

grass-knot.Name: Grass Knot
grass-knot.Effects: Grass Knot inflicts greater damage on heavier opponents, as shown in the table. For reference, the following Pokémon take 120 base damage from Grass Knot. From Generation 5 onwards, heavy Pokémon kick up dust as they land switching in. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Knot turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160
grass-knot.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Knot turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.

grass-pledge.Name: Grass Pledge
grass-pledge.Effects: Grass Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Fire Pledge or Water Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Grass Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Fire Pledge and a sea of fire envelops the foe's team is created that damages opponents 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn, for 4 turns. If Grass Pledge is used with Water Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Pledge turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160
grass-pledge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Pledge turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.

grass-whistle.Name: Grass Whistle
grass-whistle.Effects: Grass Whistle puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Whistle turns into Z-Grass Whistle and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
grass-whistle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grass Whistle turns into Z-Grass Whistle and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

grassy-glide.Name: Grassy Glide
grassy-glide.Effects:
High priority during Grassy Terrain.					
					Changes

In Generation 8, Grassy Glide has 70 base power

grassy-terrain.Name: Grassy Terrain
grassy-terrain.Effects: Grassy Terrain creates a low-lying grassy field lasting 5 turns, that restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn, by 1⁄16 of their maximum HP. The power of Grass type moves also increases by 50% while in effect, and the moves Earthquake, Magnitude, and Bulldoze halve in power. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Grassy Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Energy Ball under Grassy Terrain. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grassy Terrain turns into Z-Grassy Terrain and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
grassy-terrain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grassy Terrain turns into Z-Grassy Terrain and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

grav-apple.Name: Grav Apple
grav-apple.Effects: Lowers the opponent's Defense stat.							(100% chance

gravity.Name: Gravity
gravity.Effects: Prevents moves like Fly and Bounce and the Ability Levitate for 5 turns.
gravity.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gravity turns into Z-Gravity and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

growl.Name: Growl
growl.Effects: Growl lowers the target's Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growl turns into Z-Growl and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
growl.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growl turns into Z-Growl and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

growth.Name: Growth
growth.Effects: Growth raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. During harsh sunlight it raises each stat by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growth turns into Z-Growth and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
growth.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Growth turns into Z-Growth and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

grudge.Name: Grudge
grudge.Effects: If the users faints after using this move, the PP for the opponent's last move is depleted.
grudge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Grudge turns into Z-Grudge and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.

guard-split.Name: Guard Split
guard-split.Effects: Guard Split averages the user's Defense and Special Defense with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. For example, if the user's Defense was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Screech on the user, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Defense. Due to the stat drop, the Guard Split user's effective Defense would now be 75 (instead of the 50 it was originally). When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Split turns into Z-Guard Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
guard-split.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Split turns into Z-Guard Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

guard-swap.Name: Guard Swap
guard-swap.Effects: User and opponent swap Defense and Special Defense.
guard-swap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guard Swap turns into Z-Guard Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

guardian-of-alola.Name: Guardian of
guardian-of-alola.Effects: Guardian of Alola is a Z-move exclusive to the guardian deities of Alola - Tapu Koko, Tapu Lele, Tapu Bulu and Tapu Fini. It is used with Nature's Madness. Guardian of Alola cuts the target's HP by 75% of its remaining HP

guillotine.Name: Guillotine
guillotine.Effects: If it hits, Guillotine is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers: This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Guillotine has 30% accuracy. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guillotine turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180
guillotine.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Guillotine turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

gunk-shot.Name: Gunk Shot
gunk-shot.Effects: Gunk Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gunk Shot turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190
gunk-shot.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gunk Shot turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.

gust.Name: Gust
gust.Effects: Gust deals damage and can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop - in which case the power is doubled. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gust turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100
gust.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gust turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100.
gust.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

gyro-ball.Name: Gyro Ball
gyro-ball.Effects: Gyro Ball inflicts varying damage: the slower the user compared to the opponent, the higher the damage, up to a maximum base power of 150. The base power is calculated as: For example, if the opponent is twice as fast as the user, Gyro Ball will have base power 50. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gyro Ball turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160
gyro-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Gyro Ball turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

hail.Name: Hail
hail.Effects: Hail creates a hailstorm that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hail turns into Z-Hail and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
hail.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hail turns into Z-Hail and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

hammer-arm.Name: Hammer Arm
hammer-arm.Effects: Hammer Arm deals damage but lowers the user's Speed by one stage after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hammer Arm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180
hammer-arm.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hammer Arm turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

happy-hour.Name: Happy Hour
happy-hour.Effects: Happy Hour has no battle effect. Instead, it doubles the prize money awarded to the player at the end of the battle. If the Amulet Coin or Luck Incense is held by any Pokémon in battle, and any Pokémon uses Happy Hour during the battle, the prize money is quadrupled. Happy Hour is an event-exclusive move known by Inkay from a Japanese event. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Happy Hour turns into Z-Happy Hour and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above
happy-hour.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Happy Hour turns into Z-Happy Hour and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
happy-hour.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

hard-press.Name: Hard Press
hard-press.Effects: The target is crushed with an arm, a claw, or the like to inflict damage. The more HP the target has left, the greater the move’s power

harden.Name: Harden
harden.Effects: Harden raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Harden turns into Z-Harden and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
harden.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Harden turns into Z-Harden and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

haze.Name: Haze
haze.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Haze turns into Z-Haze and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

head-charge.Name: Head Charge
head-charge.Effects: Head Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Charge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
head-charge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Charge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

head-smash.Name: Head Smash
head-smash.Effects: Head Smash deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄2 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Smash turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200
head-smash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Head Smash turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.

headbutt.Name: Headbutt
headbutt.Effects:
Headbutt deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Headbutt turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
					Outside of battle
In Gold, Silver, Crystal, and the remakes HeartGold & SoulSilver, Headbutt can be used to shake trees. Often wild Pokémon will fall out; some Pokémon are only obtainable via this method
headbutt.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Headbutt turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
					Outside of battle
In Gold, Silver, Crystal, and the remakes HeartGold & SoulSilver, Headbutt can be used to shake trees. Often wild Pokémon will fall out; some Pokémon are only obtainable via this method.

headlong-rush.Name: Headlong Rush
headlong-rush.Effects: Headlong Rush deals damage, but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense stats by one stage each after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each

heal-bell.Name: Heal Bell
heal-bell.Effects: Heals the user's party's status conditions.
heal-bell.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Bell turns into Z-Heal Bell and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
heal-bell.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

heal-block.Name: Heal Block
heal-block.Effects: Prevents the opponent from restoring HP for 5 turns.
heal-block.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Block turns into Z-Heal Block and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

heal-order.Name: Heal Order
heal-order.Effects: Heal Order recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Order turns into Z-Heal Order and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
heal-order.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Order turns into Z-Heal Order and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

heal-pulse.Name: Heal Pulse
heal-pulse.Effects: Heal Pulse restores half of the target's maximum HP. It can be used on team-mates but not on itself. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Pulse turns into Z-Heal Pulse and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
heal-pulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heal Pulse turns into Z-Heal Pulse and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
heal-pulse.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

healing-wish.Name: Healing Wish
healing-wish.Effects: The user faints and the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
healing-wish.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Healing Wish has no additional effect.

heart-stamp.Name: Heart Stamp
heart-stamp.Effects: Heart Stamp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Stamp turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120
heart-stamp.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Stamp turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120.

heart-swap.Name: Heart Swap
heart-swap.Effects: Stat changes are swapped with the opponent.
heart-swap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heart Swap turns into Z-Heart Swap and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

heat-crash.Name: Heat Crash
heat-crash.Effects: Heat Crash inflicts more damage the heavier the user compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = UserWeight ÷ TargetWeight For example, if the user's weight is at least 4 times more than the target but less than 5 times, Heat Crash hits with 100 base power. If the target has used Minimize, Heat Crash ignores accuracy and deals double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Crash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160
heat-crash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Crash turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

heat-wave.Name: Heat Wave
heat-wave.Effects: Heat Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Wave turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175
heat-wave.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heat Wave turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 175.

heavy-slam.Name: Heavy Slam
heavy-slam.Effects: Heavy Slam inflicts more damage the heavier the user compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = UserWeight ÷ TargetWeight For example, if the user's weight is at least 4 times more than the target but less than 5 times, Heavy Slam hits with 100 base power. If the target has used Minimize, Heavy Slam ignores accuracy and deals double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heavy Slam turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160
heavy-slam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Heavy Slam turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

helping-hand.Name: Helping Hand
helping-hand.Effects: In Double Battles, boosts the power of the partner's move.
helping-hand.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Helping Hand turns into Z-Helping Hand and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
helping-hand.Target: Targets an adjacent Pokémon on the user’s team.

hex.Name: Hex
hex.Effects: Hex inflicts damage, but if the target has a major status ailment (i.e. is burned, poisoned, paralyzed, asleep or frozen) it will double in power to 130. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hex turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160
hex.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hex turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.

hidden-power.Name: Hidden Power
hidden-power.Effects: Hidden Power deals damage, however its type varies for every Pokémon, depending on that Pokémon's Individual Values (IVs). This makes it a useful move for coverage - giving the Pokémon a type of move they don't normally have. Hidden Power can be any type except Normal or Fairy. It receives STAB if the user's type matches the type given to Hidden Power. Individual Values are 6 hidden numbers (one for each stat) that are randomly generated upon encountering a Pokémon. It is not possible to find your exact IVs in-game. You can find the type of Hidden Power in-game by talking to a particular character who will state the type a Pokémon's Hidden Power would be if it learned the move. They are located at: It is also possible to determine via elimination by using the move against different Pokémon, or against Kecleon, whose ability Color Change will tell you the type. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hidden Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120
hidden-power.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hidden Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

high-horsepower.Name: High Horsepower
high-horsepower.Effects: The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body.
high-horsepower.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Horsepower turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.

high-jump-kick.Name: High Jump
high-jump-kick.Effects: High Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. High Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 195
high-jump-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, High Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 195.

hold-back.Name: Hold Back
hold-back.Effects: Always leaves opponent with at least 1 HP.
hold-back.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hold Back turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

hold-hands.Name: Hold Hands
hold-hands.Effects: Makes the user and an ally very happy.
hold-hands.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hold Hands turns into Z-Hold Hands and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
hold-hands.Target: Targets an adjacent Pokémon on the user’s team.

hone-claws.Name: Hone Claws
hone-claws.Effects: Hone Claws raises the user's Attack and Accuracy by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hone Claws turns into Z-Hone Claws and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
hone-claws.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hone Claws turns into Z-Hone Claws and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

horn-attack.Name: Horn Attack
horn-attack.Effects: Horn Attack deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120
horn-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

horn-drill.Effects: If it hits, Horn Drill is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers: This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Horn Drill has 30% accuracy. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Drill turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180
horn-drill.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Drill turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

horn-leech.Name: Horn Leech
horn-leech.Effects: Horn Leech deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Leech turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140
horn-leech.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Horn Leech turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.

howl.Name: Howl
howl.Effects: Howl raises the Attack of the user and its teammates by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Howl turns into Z-Howl and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
howl.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Howl turns into Z-Howl and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
howl.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

hurricane.Name: Hurricane
hurricane.Effects: Hurricane deals damage and has a 30% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. If used during rain, Hurricane ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 50%. Hurricane can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Fly and Bounce. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hurricane turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 185
hurricane.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hurricane turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 185.
hurricane.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

hydro-cannon.Name: Hydro Cannon
hydro-cannon.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Cannon turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200.

hydro-pump.Name: Hydro Pump
hydro-pump.Effects: Hydro Pump deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Pump turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185
hydro-pump.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Pump turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.

hydro-steam.Name: Hydro Steam
hydro-steam.Effects: Hydro Steam deals damage, and its power is boosted by 50% in harsh sunlight, instead of being reduced

hydro-vortex.Name: Hydro Vortex
hydro-vortex.Effects: Hydro Vortex is the Water type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

hyper-beam.Name: Hyper Beam
hyper-beam.Effects: Hyper Beam deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn). If the user has the ability Truant, it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around. Hyper Beam is the Special counterpart to Giga Impact. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Beam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200
hyper-beam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Beam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

hyper-fang.Name: Hyper Fang
hyper-fang.Effects: Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
hyper-fang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

hyper-voice.Name: Hyper Voice
hyper-voice.Effects:
Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes.
Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175
hyper-voice.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.

hyperspace-fury.Name: Hyperspace Fury
hyperspace-fury.Effects: Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Fury turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 180
hyperspace-fury.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Fury turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 180.

hyperspace-hole.Name: Hyperspace Hole
hyperspace-hole.Effects: Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect-like move. It is the signature move of Hoopa. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Hole turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160
hyperspace-hole.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Hole turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

hypnosis.Name: Hypnosis
hypnosis.Effects: Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hypnosis turns into Z-Hypnosis and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
hypnosis.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hypnosis turns into Z-Hypnosis and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

ice-ball.Name: Ice Ball
ice-ball.Effects: Ice Ball deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Ice Ball doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively. As Ice Ball has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Ice Ball is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Ball turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100
ice-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Ball turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

ice-beam.Name: Ice Beam
ice-beam.Effects: Ice Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 175
ice-beam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 175.

ice-burn.Name: Ice Burn
ice-burn.Effects: The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Ice Burn executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Burn turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200
ice-burn.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Burn turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.

ice-fang.Name: Ice Fang
ice-fang.Effects: Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Fang turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120
ice-fang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Fang turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.

ice-hammer.Name: Ice Hammer
ice-hammer.Effects: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however.							(100% chance)
ice-hammer.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Hammer turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.

ice-punch.Name: Ice Punch
ice-punch.Effects: Ice Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Punch turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140
ice-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Punch turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.

ice-shard.Name: Ice Shard
ice-shard.Effects: Ice Shard deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Shard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100
ice-shard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Shard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

icicle-crash.Name: Icicle Crash
icicle-crash.Effects: Icicle Crash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Crash turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 160
icicle-crash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Crash turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 160.

icicle-spear.Name: Icicle Spear
icicle-spear.Effects: Icicle Spear hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Icicle Spear is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Icicle Spear to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Spear turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140
icicle-spear.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Spear turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.

icy-wind.Name: Icy Wind
icy-wind.Effects: Icy Wind deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icy Wind turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100
icy-wind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icy Wind turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

imprison.Name: Imprison
imprison.Effects: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows.
imprison.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Imprison turns into Z-Imprison and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

incinerate.Name: Incinerate
incinerate.Effects: Incinerate deals damage and if the target is holding a Berry, it is burnt and becomes no longer usable. If Incinerate would be super-effective and the target is holding an Occa Berry, the Berry activates before the move hits so does not get burnt. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Incinerate turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120
incinerate.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Incinerate turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.

infernal-parade.Name: Infernal Parade
infernal-parade.Effects: Infernal Parade deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. If the target already has a status condition, its power is doubled. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned

inferno.Name: Inferno
inferno.Effects: Inferno deals damage and burns the target, if it hits. Burned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn and their Attack is decreased by 50%. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Inferno turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180
inferno.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Inferno turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

inferno-overdrive.Name: Inferno Overdrive
inferno-overdrive.Effects: Inferno Overdrive is the Fire type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

infestation.Name: Infestation
infestation.Effects: Infestation inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Infestation turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100
infestation.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Infestation turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

ingrain.Name: Ingrain
ingrain.Effects: The user of Ingrain plants it roots, which restores 1⁄16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, but prevents switching out. Only the moves Baton Pass, U Turn or Volt Switch will allow the user to switch out, with Baton Pass transferring the effects of Ingrain. Moves such as Roar used on this Pokémon will have no effect. Ingrain cancels effects given to raised Pokémon such as immunity to Ground-type moves, Spikes and so on. See more in the glossary. If the user is holding a Big Root, Ingrain restores 30% more HP each turn - approximately 1⁄12 of its maximum. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ingrain turns into Z-Ingrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
ingrain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ingrain turns into Z-Ingrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

instruct.Name: Instruct
instruct.Effects: Instruct tells the user's teammate in a double/triple battle to use its most recent move instead of them. In other words, it allows a teammate to attack twice instead of the two Pokémon attacking once each. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Instruct turns into Z-Instruct and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
instruct.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Instruct turns into Z-Instruct and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

ion-deluge.Name: Ion Deluge
ion-deluge.Effects: Ion Deluge changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type for all Pokémon on the field, for the remainder of the turn. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ion Deluge turns into Z-Ion Deluge and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
ion-deluge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ion Deluge turns into Z-Ion Deluge and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

iron-defense.Name: Iron Defense
iron-defense.Effects: Iron Defense raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Defense turns into Z-Iron Defense and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
iron-defense.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Defense turns into Z-Iron Defense and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

iron-head.Name: Iron Head
iron-head.Effects: Iron Head deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Head turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160
iron-head.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Head turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.

iron-tail.Name: Iron Tail
iron-tail.Effects: Iron Tail deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Tail turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180
iron-tail.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Tail turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.

ivy-cudgel.Name: Ivy Cudgel
ivy-cudgel.Effects: Ivy Cudgel deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). Its type changes based on the mask worn by Ogerpon

jaw-lock.Name: Jaw Lock
jaw-lock.Effects: Prevents user and opponent from switching out

judgment.Name: Judgment
judgment.Effects: Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.
judgment.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Judgment turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.

jump-kick.Name: Jump Kick
jump-kick.Effects: Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1⁄2 of its maximum HP. Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180
jump-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.

jungle-healing.Name: Jungle Healing
jungle-healing.Effects: Restores team's HP and cures status conditions
jungle-healing.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

karate-chop.Name: Karate Chop
karate-chop.Effects: Karate Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Karate Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100
karate-chop.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Karate Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

kinesis.Name: Kinesis
kinesis.Effects: Kinesis lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Kinesis turns into Z-Kinesis and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
kinesis.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Kinesis turns into Z-Kinesis and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

kings-shield.Name: King's Shield
kings-shield.Effects: King's Shield prevents any Physical or Special attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the King's Shield user, the opponent's Attack is lowered by two stages. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. The accuracy of King's Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, or Baneful Bunker. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, King's Shield turns into Z-King's Shield and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
kings-shield.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, King's Shield turns into Z-King's Shield and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

knock-off.Name: Knock Off
knock-off.Effects: Knock Off deals damage and if the target has a held item, damage is increased by 50% (i.e. 97.5 base power) and the item is removed for the remainder of the battle (switching out does not restore the item). All items are restored at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. Note that in these cases the damage dealt does not increase. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Knock Off turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120
knock-off.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Knock Off turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

lands-wrath.Name: Land's Wrath
lands-wrath.Effects: Land's Wrath deals damage with no additional effects. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Land's Wrath turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 185
lands-wrath.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Land's Wrath turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 185.

laser-focus.Name: Laser Focus
laser-focus.Effects: User's next attack is guaranteed to result in a critical hit.
laser-focus.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Laser Focus turns into Z-Laser Focus and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

lash-out.Name: Lash Out
lash-out.Effects: The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward the target. If its stats were lowered during the turn, the power of this move is doubled. Lash Out is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

last-resort.Name: Last Resort
last-resort.Effects: Last Resort deals high damage, but will fail if the user has not used each of its other moves at least once (or has no other moves). If the user switches out, the move gets reset and when it switches back in, will need to use each of its other moves at least once in order to use Last Resort again. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.When Eevee is holding Eevium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Extreme Evoboost
last-resort.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.When Eevee is holding Eevium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Extreme Evoboost.

last-respects.Name: Last Respects
last-respects.Effects: Damages increases the more party Pokémon have been defeated

lava-plume.Name: Lava Plume
lava-plume.Effects: Lava Plume deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lava Plume turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160
lava-plume.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lava Plume turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.

leaf-blade.Name: Leaf Blade
leaf-blade.Effects: Leaf Blade deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175
leaf-blade.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.

leaf-storm.Name: Leaf Storm
leaf-storm.Effects: Leaf Storm deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Storm turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 195
leaf-storm.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Storm turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 195.

leaf-tornado.Name: Leaf Tornado
leaf-tornado.Effects: Leaf Tornado deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Tornado turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120
leaf-tornado.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Tornado turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.

leafage.Name: Leafage
leafage.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leafage turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

leech-life.Name: Leech Life
leech-life.Effects: Leech Life deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Life turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160
leech-life.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Life turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.

leech-seed.Name: Leech Seed
leech-seed.Effects: Leech Seed plants a seed on the target that drains 1⁄8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn and restores it to the user, or any Pokémon that takes its place. It does not work on Grass-type Pokémon; it does technically work against Pokémon with the Magic Guard ability, but no HP will be sapped. If the user is holding a Big Root, the move still saps the same amount of HP but recovers 30% more than normal. For example, if a Pokémon has 320 HP, Leech Seed would cause them to lose 40 HP each turn but the seeder would recover 52 HP. If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze, the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. The seeded Pokémon can clear Leech Seed by switching out or using Rapid Spin. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Seed turns into Z-Leech Seed and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
leech-seed.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Seed turns into Z-Leech Seed and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

leer.Name: Leer
leer.Effects: Leer lowers the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leer turns into Z-Leer and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
leer.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leer turns into Z-Leer and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

lets-snuggle-forever.Name: Let's Snuggle
lets-snuggle-forever.Effects: Let's Snuggle Forever is a Fairy type Z-Move exclusive to Mimikyu. It is used with Play Rough

lick.Name: Lick
lick.Effects: Lick deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lick turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100
lick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lick turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

life-dew.Name: Life Dew
life-dew.Effects: Life Dew recovers up to 25% of the user's and its teammate's maximum HP
life-dew.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

light-of-ruin.Name: Light of
light-of-ruin.Effects: Light of Ruin deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄2 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light of Ruin turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 200
light-of-ruin.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light of Ruin turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 200.

light-screen.Name: Light Screen
light-screen.Effects: Light Screen reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field. If the user is holding Light Clay when Light Screen is used, its effects last for 8 turns. The move Brick Break, when used against an Pokémon under Light Screen's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Light Screen. Light Screen is the Special counterpart to Reflect. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light Screen turns into Z-Light Screen and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
light-screen.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light Screen turns into Z-Light Screen and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
light-screen.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

light-that-burns-the-sky.Name: Light That
light-that-burns-the-sky.Effects: Light That Burns the Sky is a Psychic type Z-Move exclusive to Necrozma. It is used with Photon Geyser. Light That Burns the Sky ignores target's ability and inflicts damage based on the user's Attack or Special Attack, whichever is higher

liquidation.Name: Liquidation
liquidation.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Liquidation turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.

lock-on.Name: Lock-On
lock-on.Effects:
User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.					
					Changes

metronome.Name: Metronome

The random move is chosen at the point Metronome is used, so priority moves like Mach Punch will not go first. Although Metronome technically targets the user, the move it turns into will use its usual target (whether the opponent(s), teammate(s) or self), or target a random adjacent opponent in double/triple battles. Metronome will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves: If the user is holding a Choice Band, Choice Specs or Choice Scarf, multi-turn moves such as Dig or Rollout will fail on the second turn. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metronome turns into Z-Metronome and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Tectonic Rage if Earthquake was chosen), in addition to its usual effect as above

misty-terrain.Name: Misty Terrain
misty-terrain.Effects: Misty Terrain creates a low-lying mist lasting 5 turns, that protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions (including confusion). It also halves the power of Dragon type moves while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Misty Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Moonblast under Misty Terrain. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Misty Terrain turns into Z-Misty Terrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
misty-terrain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Misty Terrain turns into Z-Misty Terrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

moonblast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moonblast turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 175.

moonlight.Name: Moonlight

mortal-spin.Name: Mortal Spin

mud-bomb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Bomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 120.

mud-shot.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Shot turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.

multi-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Multi-Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 185.

mystical-fire.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mystical Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.

natural-gift.Name: Natural Gift
natural-gift.Effects: Natural Gift deals damage with no additional effects. However, its type and base power vary depending on the user's held Berry. The grid below shows which Berries provide which power and type. For example, if a Pokémon holding a Cheri Berry uses Natural Gift, it will become a base power 60, Fire-type attack; holding a Starf Berry it will become an 80 power Psychic-type move. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Natural Gift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
natural-gift.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Natural Gift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

nature-power.Name: Nature Power
nature-power.Effects: When Nature Power is used it turns into a different move depending on the current battle terrain, as listed below. Although it's a Normal type move, the user only receives STAB if the move it turns into is their type. For example, Sawsbuck (Normal/Grass) would not obtain STAB if Nature Power turned into Hydro Pump, but Ludicolo would. Note: the category shown is as it was in Generation 3. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature Power turns into Z-Nature Power and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Hydro Vortex when on water), in addition to its usual effect as above
nature-power.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature Power turns into Z-Nature Power and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Hydro Vortex when on water), in addition to its usual effect as above.

night-daze.Effects: Night Daze deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. nuzzle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nuzzle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

In battle, the user flies high into the sky then releases a beam of red light that scorches the ground. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Oblivion Wing turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160
oblivion-wing.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Oblivion Wing turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.

obstruct.Name: Obstruct
obstruct.Effects: Obstruct prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the user on that turn, the attacker's Defense is lowered by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each

oceanic-operetta.Name: Oceanic Operetta

octazooka.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Octazooka turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.

odor-sleuth.Name: Odor Sleuth
odor-sleuth.Effects:
Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.					
					Changes

In Generation 3, Odor Sleuth has 100% accuracy.
odor-sleuth.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Odor Sleuth turns into Z-Odor Sleuth and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

ominous-wind.Name: Ominous Wind
ominous-wind.Effects: Ominous Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ominous Wind turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120
ominous-wind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ominous Wind turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.

order-up.Name: Order Up

origin-pulse.Name: Origin Pulse

origin-pulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Origin Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.

outrage.Name: Outrage
outrage.Effects: The user of Outrage attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Outrage is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Outrage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 190
outrage.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Outrage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 190.
outrage.Target: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.

overheat.Name: Overheat
overheat.Effects: Overheat deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Overheat turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 195
overheat.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Overheat turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 195.

In Generation 2, Pain Split has 100% accuracy.

pin-missile.Name: Pin Missile

The Skill Link ability will cause Pin Missile to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pin Missile turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140
