powder.Name: Powder
powder.Effects: Powder moves with priority and covers the target in a powder that lasts for the rest of the current turn only. It damages the target if they use a Fire type move in that turn, and prevents the Fire move from working. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder turns into Z-Powder and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above
powder.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder turns into Z-Powder and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

powder-snow.Name: Powder Snow
powder-snow.Effects: Powder Snow deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder Snow turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100
powder-snow.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder Snow turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.

power-gem.Name: Power Gem
power-gem.Effects: Power Gem deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Gem turns into Continental Crush and has base power 160
power-gem.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Gem turns into Continental Crush and has base power 160.

power-shift.Name: Power Shift
power-shift.Effects: Power Shift switches the user's Attack stat with its Defense

power-split.Name: Power Split
power-split.Effects: Power Split averages the user's Attack and Special Attack with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. The effect lasts until the battle ends or the Pokémon switches out. For example, if the user's Attack was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used  Swords Dance, then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Attack. Due to the stat boost, the opponent's effective Attack would now be 300 (instead of the 400 it was originally). When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Split turns into Z-Power Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
power-split.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Split turns into Z-Power Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

power-swap.Name: Power Swap
power-swap.Effects: User and opponent swap Attack and Special Attack.
power-swap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Swap turns into Z-Power Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

power-trick.Name: Power Trick
power-trick.Effects: User's own Attack and Defense switch.
power-trick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trick turns into Z-Power Trick and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

power-trip.Name: Power Trip
power-trip.Effects: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.
power-trip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trip turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

power-whip.Name: Power Whip
power-whip.Effects: Power Whip deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190
power-whip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

power-up-punch.Name: Power-Up Punch
power-up-punch.Effects: Power-Up Punch deals damage and raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power-Up Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100
power-up-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power-Up Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

precipice-blades.Name: Precipice Blades
precipice-blades.Effects: Precipice Blades deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles. It is the signature move of Groudon. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Precipice Blades turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 190
precipice-blades.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Precipice Blades turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 190.

present.Name: Present
present.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Present turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

prismatic-laser.Name: Prismatic Laser
prismatic-laser.Effects: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.
prismatic-laser.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Prismatic Laser turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.

protect.Name: Protect
protect.Effects: Protect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Detect. The accuracy of Protect decreases by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, Spiky Shield, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Protect but deal 1⁄4 of the damage. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Protect turns into Z-Protect and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
protect.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Protect turns into Z-Protect and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

psybeam.Name: Psybeam
psybeam.Effects: Psybeam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psybeam turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120
psybeam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psybeam turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120.

psyblade.Name: Psyblade
psyblade.Effects: Psyblade deals damage, and its power is boosted by 50% on Electric Terrain

psych-up.Name: Psych Up
psych-up.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psych Up turns into Z-Psych Up and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

psychic.Name: Psychic
psychic.Effects: Psychic deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 175.When Mew is holding Mewnium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic turns into Genesis Supernova and has base power 185
psychic.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 175.When Mew is holding Mewnium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic turns into Genesis Supernova and has base power 185.

psychic-fangs.Name: Psychic Fangs
psychic-fangs.Effects: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.
psychic-fangs.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Fangs turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

psychic-noise.Name: Psychic Noise
psychic-noise.Effects: Deals damage and prevents target from healing

psychic-terrain.Name: Psychic Terrain
psychic-terrain.Effects: Psychic Terrain creates a low-lying psychic field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from being hit by high-priority moves (such as Quick Attack or Sucker Punch). The power of Psychic type moves also increases while in effect. Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Psychic Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions. The move Nature Power turns into Psychic under Psychic Terrain. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Terrain turns into Z-Psychic Terrain and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
psychic-terrain.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Terrain turns into Z-Psychic Terrain and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

psycho-boost.Name: Psycho Boost
psycho-boost.Effects: Psycho Boost deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Boost turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200
psycho-boost.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Boost turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.

psycho-cut.Name: Psycho Cut
psycho-cut.Effects: Psycho Cut deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Cut turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140
psycho-cut.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Cut turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.

psycho-shift.Name: Psycho Shift
psycho-shift.Effects: Psycho Shift transfers any major status condition the user has (Poison, Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Freeze) to the target, if the target does not already have a status condition. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Shift turns into Z-Psycho Shift and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above
psycho-shift.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Shift turns into Z-Psycho Shift and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

psyshield-bash.Name: Psyshield Bash
psyshield-bash.Effects: Psyshield Bash deals damage and raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

psyshock.Name: Psyshock
psyshock.Effects: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
psyshock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psyshock turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

psystrike.Name: Psystrike
psystrike.Effects: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
psystrike.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psystrike turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.

psywave.Name: Psywave
psywave.Effects: Psywave inflicts a random amount of HP damage, varying between 50% and 150% of the user's level. In other words, at level 100 the damage will be 50-150 HP. The damage is typeless (not affected by type advantages/disadvantages) but it still does not hit Dark type Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psywave turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 100
psywave.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psywave turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 100.

pulverizing-pancake.Name: Pulverizing Pancake
pulverizing-pancake.Effects: Pulverizing Pancake is a Normal type Z-Move exclusive to Snorlax. It is used with Giga Impact

punishment.Name: Punishment
punishment.Effects: Punishment deals varying damage based on the opponent's stat increases. It starts at base power 60 and increases by 20 for every net stat boost of the opponent, up to a maximum of 200 (7 boosts). In other words the power is: For example, if the opponent used Nasty Plot and Agility once each, that is a total of 4 stat increases (+2 Special Attack, +2 Speed) and Punishment's base power will be 20 × 4 + 60 = 140. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Punishment turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160
punishment.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Punishment turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

purify.Name: Purify
purify.Effects: The user heals the target's status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user's own HP.
purify.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Purify turns into Z-Purify and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

pursuit.Name: Pursuit
pursuit.Effects: Pursuit deals damage, and hits with double power if the target is switching out. In that case, Pursuit technically has priority +7, meaning it attacks before all other actions and moves. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pursuit turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100
pursuit.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pursuit turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.

quash.Name: Quash
quash.Effects: Quash forces the target Pokémon to move last in the current turn. It does not have priority so will fail if the target already moved in the current turn. Therefore it is useless in single battles and only works in double/triple battles. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quash turns into Z-Quash and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
quash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quash turns into Z-Quash and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

quick-attack.Name: Quick Attack
quick-attack.Effects: Quick Attack deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
quick-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

quick-guard.Name: Quick Guard
quick-guard.Effects: Quick Guard protects the user's team from all increased priority moves (such as Extreme Speed or Bullet Punch), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Quick Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Wide Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1⁄3 each time it or Wide Guard is used. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Guard turns into Z-Quick Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
quick-guard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Guard turns into Z-Quick Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
quick-guard.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

quiver-dance.Name: Quiver Dance
quiver-dance.Effects: Quiver Dance raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quiver Dance turns into Z-Quiver Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
quiver-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quiver Dance turns into Z-Quiver Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

rage.Name: Rage
rage.Effects: Rage deals damage, and if the user is hit by a direct attack - any time after Rage is first used but before a different move is used - the user's Attack is raised by one stage. The game will state the Pokémon's rage is building rather than explicitly assert the stat increase. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. The Attack increases will continue as long as Rage is the last move used, even if it misses, the user is incapacitated (paralyzed, sleeping, etc) or the player uses an item. The Attack increase activates for every blow of multi-hit moves such as DoubleSlap or Fury Swipes. As an example, if a Pokémon uses Rage then the opponent hits the user in the same turn, the user's Attack increases. If the user moves last it will not increase that turn, but will in the next turn if the opponent hits the user again. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
rage.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

rage-fist.Name: Rage Fist
rage-fist.Effects: The more times the user has been hit by attacks, the greater the move's power

rage-powder.Name: Rage Powder
rage-powder.Effects: Rage Powder redirects all single-target moves used by opponents to itself. It is only useful in double or triple battles. It does not work for moves that target multiple Pokémon such as Air Cutter or Bulldoze. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage Powder turns into Z-Rage Powder and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
rage-powder.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage Powder turns into Z-Rage Powder and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

raging-bull.Name: Raging Bull
raging-bull.Effects: Type depends on the user’s form. Breaks through Reflect and Light Screen barriers

raging-fury.Name: Raging Fury
raging-fury.Effects: The user of Raging Fury attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Raging Fury is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused
raging-fury.Target: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.

rain-dance.Name: Rain Dance
rain-dance.Effects: Rain Dance causes a rain shower that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rain Dance turns into Z-Rain Dance and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
rain-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rain Dance turns into Z-Rain Dance and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

rapid-spin.Name: Rapid Spin
rapid-spin.Effects: Rapid Spin deals damage, raises the user's Speed by one stage, and removes the effects of several trap moves and entry hazards. It fails if the move misses or the target is immune. The effects from the following moves are removed: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rapid Spin turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
rapid-spin.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rapid Spin turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

razor-leaf.Name: Razor Leaf
razor-leaf.Effects: Razor Leaf deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Leaf turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100
razor-leaf.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Leaf turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

razor-shell.Name: Razor Shell
razor-shell.Effects: Razor Shell deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Shell turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 140
razor-shell.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Shell turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 140.

razor-wind.Name: Razor Wind
razor-wind.Effects: The user of Razor Wind will whip up a whirlwind on the first turn. On the second turn, Razor Wind deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). If the user is holding a Power Herb, Razor Wind executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Wind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
razor-wind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Wind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

recover.Name: Recover
recover.Effects: Recover restores up to 50% of the user's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recover turns into Z-Recover and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
recover.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recover turns into Z-Recover and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

recycle.Name: Recycle
recycle.Effects: User's used hold item is restored.
recycle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recycle turns into Z-Recycle and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

reflect.Name: Reflect
reflect.Effects: Reflect reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field. If the user is holding Light Clay when Reflect is used, its effects last for 8 turns. The move Brick Break, when used against an Pokémon under Reflect's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Reflect. Reflect is the Physical counterpart to Light Screen. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect turns into Z-Reflect and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
reflect.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect turns into Z-Reflect and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
reflect.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

reflect-type.Name: Reflect Type
reflect-type.Effects: Reflect Type changes the user's type to match the type(s) of the target. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect Type turns into Z-Reflect Type and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
reflect-type.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect Type turns into Z-Reflect Type and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

refresh.Name: Refresh
refresh.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Refresh turns into Z-Refresh and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

relic-song.Name: Relic Song
relic-song.Effects: May put the target to sleep.							(10% chance)
relic-song.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Relic Song turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

rest.Name: Rest
rest.Effects:
User sleeps for 2 turns, but user is fully healed.					
					Changes

In Generations 1-8, Rest has 10 PP.
rest.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rest turns into Z-Rest and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

retaliate.Name: Retaliate
retaliate.Effects: Inflicts double damage if a teammate fainted on the last turn.
retaliate.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Retaliate turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

return.Name: Return
return.Effects: The power of Return is higher when the user likes its trainer more. The base power varies between 1 (minimum Friendship) and 102 (maximum Friendship). The exact formula is: Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 (more details). Return is the counterpart move to Frustration. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Return turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
return.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Return turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

revelation-dance.Name: Revelation Dance
revelation-dance.Effects: Revelation Dance deals damage with a different type depending on the style of Oricorio: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revelation Dance turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175
revelation-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revelation Dance turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.

revenge.Name: Revenge
revenge.Effects: Power increases if user was hit first.
revenge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revenge turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

reversal.Name: Reversal
reversal.Effects: Reversal deals more damage the lower the user's HP is, as per the table below. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reversal turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160
reversal.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reversal turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

revival-blessing.Name: Revival Blessing
revival-blessing.Effects: Revives a fainted party Pokémon to half HP

rising-voltage.Name: Rising Voltage
rising-voltage.Effects: The user attacks with electric voltage rising from the ground. This move’s power doubles when the target is on Electric Terrain. Rising Voltage is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

roar.Name: Roar
roar.Effects: In the wild, Roar causes the target Pokémon to flee if they are of a lower level, and the battle ends. In trainer battles (including linked battles), Roar forces the target to switch out of battle (regardless of level) and is replaced with another Pokémon in the trainer's team. Pokémon with the abilities Soundproof or Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Roar. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar turns into Z-Roar and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
roar.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar turns into Z-Roar and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

roar-of-time.Name: Roar of
roar-of-time.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar of Time turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 200.

rock-blast.Name: Rock Blast
rock-blast.Effects: Rock Blast hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Rock Blast is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Rock Blast to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Blast turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140
rock-blast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Blast turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140.

rock-climb.Name: Rock Climb
rock-climb.Effects:
Rock Climb deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Climb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Rock Climb can be used to ascend rocky paths, in Generation 4 only. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge
rock-climb.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Climb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Rock Climb can be used to ascend rocky paths, in Generation 4 only. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.

rock-polish.Name: Rock Polish
rock-polish.Effects: Rock Polish raises the user's Speed by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Polish turns into Z-Rock Polish and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
rock-polish.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Polish turns into Z-Rock Polish and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

rock-slide.Name: Rock Slide
rock-slide.Effects: Rock Slide deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Slide turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140
rock-slide.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Slide turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140.

rock-smash.Name: Rock Smash
rock-smash.Effects:
Rock Smash deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Smash turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Rock Smash breaks certain rocks that may be in your path. Smashing rocks may uncover wild Pokémon or items. Breakable rocks appear in Generations 2-4 and Generation 6. Only rocks in Johto/Hoenn reveal Pokémon/items when smashed
rock-smash.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Smash turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Rock Smash breaks certain rocks that may be in your path. Smashing rocks may uncover wild Pokémon or items. Breakable rocks appear in Generations 2-4 and Generation 6. Only rocks in Johto/Hoenn reveal Pokémon/items when smashed.

rock-throw.Name: Rock Throw
rock-throw.Effects: Rock Throw deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Throw turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100
rock-throw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Throw turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

rock-tomb.Name: Rock Tomb
rock-tomb.Effects: Rock Tomb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Tomb turns into Continental Crush and has base power 120
rock-tomb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Tomb turns into Continental Crush and has base power 120.

rock-wrecker.Name: Rock Wrecker
rock-wrecker.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Wrecker turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.

role-play.Name: Role Play
role-play.Effects: Role Play copies the opponent's ability, replacing its own with that of the target's. Role Play does not work on Pokémon with Wonder Guard or Multitype. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Role Play turns into Z-Role Play and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
role-play.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Role Play turns into Z-Role Play and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

rolling-kick.Name: Rolling Kick
rolling-kick.Effects: Rolling Kick deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rolling Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120
rolling-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rolling Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

rollout.Name: Rollout
rollout.Effects: Rollout deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Rollout will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively. If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Rollout doubles in power, i.e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively. As Rollout has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Rollout is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rollout turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100
rollout.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rollout turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.

roost.Name: Roost
roost.Effects:
User recovers half of its max HP and loses the Flying type temporarily.					
					Changes

In Generations 4-8, Roost has 10 PP.
roost.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roost turns into Z-Roost and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

rototiller.Name: Rototiller
rototiller.Effects: Rototiller raises the Attack and Special Attack of any Grass-type Pokémon on the field by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rototiller turns into Z-Rototiller and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
rototiller.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rototiller turns into Z-Rototiller and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

round.Name: Round
round.Effects: Round deals damage. If multiple Pokémon on the same team use it in the same turn, the power doubles to 120 and the slower Pokémon move immediately after the fastest Pokémon uses it, regardless of their Speed. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Round turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120
round.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Round turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

sacred-fire.Name: Sacred Fire
sacred-fire.Effects: Sacred Fire deals damage and has a 50% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Sacred Fire can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180
sacred-fire.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

sacred-sword.Name: Sacred Sword
sacred-sword.Effects: Sacred Sword deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i.e. Defense and Evasion in this case). Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 175
sacred-sword.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 175.

safeguard.Name: Safeguard
safeguard.Effects: The user's party is protected from status conditions.
safeguard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Safeguard turns into Z-Safeguard and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
safeguard.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

salt-cure.Name: Salt Cure
salt-cure.Effects: Deals damage each turn; Steel and Water types are more affected

sand-attack.Name: Sand Attack
sand-attack.Effects: Sand Attack lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Although it is a Ground-type move it still affects raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye, Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Attack turns into Z-Sand Attack and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sand-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Attack turns into Z-Sand Attack and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sand-tomb.Name: Sand Tomb
sand-tomb.Effects: Sand Tomb inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Tomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100
sand-tomb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Tomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.
sand-tomb.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

sandsear-storm.Name: Sandsear Storm
sandsear-storm.Effects: Sandsear Storm deals damage and has a 20% chance of burning the target. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 20% chance of burning). Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If used during rain, Sandsear Storm ignores accuracy

sandstorm.Name: Sandstorm
sandstorm.Effects: Sandstorm creates a sandstorm on the battlefield that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sandstorm turns into Z-Sandstorm and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sandstorm.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sandstorm turns into Z-Sandstorm and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sappy-seed.Name: Sappy Seed
sappy-seed.Effects: Sappy Seed deals damage and plants a seed on the target that drains 1⁄8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn (similar to Leech Seed). Sappy Seed is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Sizzly Slide, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl

savage-spin-out.Name: Savage Spin-Out
savage-spin-out.Effects: Savage Spin-Out is the Bug type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

scald.Name: Scald
scald.Effects: Scald deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is frozen, Scald can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scald turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160
scald.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scald turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.

scale-shot.Name: Scale Shot

scary-face.Name: Scary Face
scary-face.Effects: Scary Face lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scary Face turns into Z-Scary Face and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
scary-face.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scary Face turns into Z-Scary Face and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

scorching-sands.Name: Scorching Sands
scorching-sands.Effects: The user throws scorching sand at the target to attack. This may also leave the target with a burn. Scorching Sands is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

scratch.Name: Scratch
scratch.Effects: Scratch is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scratch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
scratch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scratch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

screech.Name: Screech
screech.Effects: Screech lowers the target's Defense by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Screech turns into Z-Screech and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
screech.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Screech turns into Z-Screech and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

searing-shot.Name: Searing Shot
searing-shot.Effects: Searing Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Searing Shot turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180
searing-shot.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Searing Shot turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.

searing-sunraze-smash.Name: Searing Sunraze
searing-sunraze-smash.Effects: Searing Sunraze Smash is a Steel type Z-Move exclusive to Solgaleo and Dusk Mane Necrozma, introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon. It is used with Solgaleo's signature move, Sunsteel Strike. Searing Sunraze Smash deals damage, ignoring the target's ability

secret-power.Name: Secret Power
secret-power.Effects:
Secret Power deals damage and has a 30% chance of inducing a secondary effect on the opponent, depending on the environment. The move's animation also changes, reusing that of a specific attack for each terrain. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
					Outside of battle
In Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, Secret Power allows the user to create their own secret base when used on weeping willow-like trees or indented walls
secret-power.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
					Outside of battle
In Ruby, Sapphire, Emerald, Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire, Secret Power allows the user to create their own secret base when used on weeping willow-like trees or indented walls.

secret-sword.Name: Secret Sword
secret-sword.Effects: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
secret-sword.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

seed-bomb.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seed Bomb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.

seed-flare.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seed Flare turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

seismic-toss.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seismic Toss turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

self-destruct.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Self-Destruct turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.

shadow-ball.Name: Shadow Ball

When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Ball turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160
shadow-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Ball turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.

shadow-claw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Claw turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 140.

shadow-force.Name: Shadow Force
shadow-force.Effects: The user of Shadow Force will vanish instantly on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Shadow Force deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect. It also removes their effect for the rest of the turn (in double and triple battles). While disappeared, the Pokémon can only be hit by moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Shadow Force executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 190
shadow-force.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 190.

shadow-punch.Name: Shadow Punch
shadow-punch.Effects: Shadow Punch deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Punch turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120
shadow-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Punch turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.

shadow-sneak.Name: Shadow Sneak
shadow-sneak.Effects: Shadow Sneak deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Sneak turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100
shadow-sneak.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Sneak turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.

sharpen.Name: Sharpen
sharpen.Effects: Sharpen raises the user's Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sharpen turns into Z-Sharpen and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sharpen.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sharpen turns into Z-Sharpen and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

shattered-psyche.Name: Shattered Psyche
shattered-psyche.Effects: Shattered Psyche is the Psychic type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

shed-tail.Name: Shed Tail
shed-tail.Effects: Creates a substitute, then swaps places with a party Pokémon in waiting

sheer-cold.Name: Sheer Cold
sheer-cold.Effects: If it hits, Sheer Cold is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level or is Ice type. Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, if the user is Ice type, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers: This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Sheer Cold has 30% accuracy. If the user is not Ice type, its accuracy percentage is: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sheer Cold turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180
sheer-cold.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sheer Cold turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.

shell-side-arm.Name: Shell Side
shell-side-arm.Effects: May poison opponent. Inflicts either Special or Physical damage, whichever is better

shell-smash.Name: Shell Smash
shell-smash.Effects: Shell Smash lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each, while also raising Attack, Special Attack and Speed by two stages each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Smash turns into Z-Shell Smash and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
shell-smash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Smash turns into Z-Shell Smash and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

shell-trap.Name: Shell Trap
shell-trap.Effects: Shell Trap sets a trap at the beginning of the turn, and if the user is hit by a physical move during the turn, it deals high damage to the opponent. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Trap turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200
shell-trap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Trap turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

shelter.Name: Shelter
shelter.Effects: Shelter raises the user's Defense by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

shift-gear.Name: Shift Gear
shift-gear.Effects: Shift Gear raises the user's Attack by one stage and Speed by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shift Gear turns into Z-Shift Gear and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
shift-gear.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shift Gear turns into Z-Shift Gear and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

shock-wave.Name: Shock Wave
shock-wave.Effects: Shock Wave deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shock Wave turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120
shock-wave.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shock Wave turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

shore-up.Name: Shore Up
shore-up.Effects:
The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.					
					Changes

In Generations 7-8, Shore Up has 10 PP.
shore-up.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shore Up turns into Z-Shore Up and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

signal-beam.Name: Signal Beam
signal-beam.Effects: Signal Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Signal Beam turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140
signal-beam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Signal Beam turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.

silk-trap.Name: Silk Trap
silk-trap.Effects: Protects the user and lowers opponent's Speed on contact

silver-wind.Name: Silver Wind
silver-wind.Effects: Silver Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Silver Wind turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120
silver-wind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Silver Wind turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120.

simple-beam.Name: Simple Beam
simple-beam.Effects: Simple Beam changes the target's ability to Simple. It does not cancel any ability's effects already felt (such as the Attack drop from Intimidate), but it does stop any further effects the ability may have (for example, damage from Rough Skin). It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant or Multitype. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Simple Beam turns into Z-Simple Beam and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
simple-beam.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Simple Beam turns into Z-Simple Beam and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sing.Name: Sing
sing.Effects: Sing puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sing turns into Z-Sing and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sing.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sing turns into Z-Sing and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sinister-arrow-raid.Name: Sinister Arrow
sinister-arrow-raid.Effects: Sinister Arrow Raid is a Ghost type Z-move exclusive to Decidueye. It is used with Decidueye's signature move Spirit Shackle

sizzly-slide.Name: Sizzly Slide
sizzly-slide.Effects: Sizzly Slide deals damage and burns the opponent. Sizzly Slide is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble, Buzzy Buzz, Glitzy Glow, Baddy Bad, Sappy Seed, Freezy Frost, and Sparkly Swirl

sketch.Name: Sketch
sketch.Effects: Permanently copies the opponent's last move.
sketch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sketch turns into Z-Sketch and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

skill-swap.Name: Skill Swap
skill-swap.Effects: The user swaps Abilities with the opponent.
skill-swap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Skill Swap turns into Z-Skill Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

skitter-smack.Name: Skitter Smack
skitter-smack.Effects: The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat. Skitter Smack is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

skull-bash.Name: Skull Bash
skull-bash.Effects: The user of Skull Bash will tuck in its head on the first turn and raise its Defense by one stage. On the second turn, Skull Bash deals damage. If the user is holding a Power Herb, Skull Bash executes in one turn. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Skull Bash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 195
skull-bash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Skull Bash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 195.

sky-attack.Name: Sky Attack
sky-attack.Effects: The user of Sky Attack will become cloaked in a harsh light on the first turn. On the second turn, Sky Attack deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).. It also has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). If the user is holding a Power Herb, Sky Attack executes in one turn. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effects of Lucky Chant, are protected against critical hits. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 200
sky-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 200.
sky-attack.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

sky-drop.Name: Sky Drop
sky-drop.Effects: Sky Drop takes the target into the air on the first turn, then drops them on the second turn, wherein they receive damage. While in the air, neither Pokémon can be hit, except by Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thunder or Twister. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit. Sky Drop will appear to work on Flying-types and those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis, but will not cause them any damage. It fails if Gravity is in effect, the target is holding an Iron Ball, or is behind a Substitute. There is a glitch with Sky Drop in Black/White in double battles. If Gravity is put into effect while the Pokémon are in the air, the user of Sky Drop returns to the ground, but the target stays in the air and cannot attack or be hit (besides the moves noted above). Due to this, it was briefly banned from Wi-Fi battles and all official Pokémon competitions. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Drop turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120
sky-drop.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Drop turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
sky-drop.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

sky-uppercut.Name: Sky Uppercut
sky-uppercut.Effects: Sky Uppercut deals damage and can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Uppercut turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160
sky-uppercut.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Uppercut turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

slack-off.Name: Slack Off
slack-off.Effects: Slack Off recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slack Off turns into Z-Slack Off and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
slack-off.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slack Off turns into Z-Slack Off and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smack Down turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100

spike-cannon.Name: Spike Cannon
spike-cannon.Effects: Spike Cannon hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Spike Cannon is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Spike Cannon to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spike Cannon turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
spike-cannon.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spike Cannon turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

spikes.Name: Spikes
spikes.Effects: Spikes lays a trap of thorns around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. It can be used up to three times to inflict more damage on incoming Pokémon, equal to a fraction of the Pokémon's HP as shown in the table. The move will not cause damage to any raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Spikes can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target). When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spikes turns into Z-Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
spikes.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spikes turns into Z-Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
spikes.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.

spiky-shield.Name: Spiky Shield
spiky-shield.Effects: Spiky Shield prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Spiky Shield user on that turn, the attacker receives damage of 1⁄8 their maximum HP. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. Contact damage does not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities. The accuracy of Spiky Shield drops by 1⁄3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect, Detect, Endure, Wide Guard, Quick Guard, King's Shield, or Baneful Bunker. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spiky Shield turns into Z-Spiky Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
spiky-shield.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spiky Shield turns into Z-Spiky Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spirit Shackle turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.When Decidueye is holding Decidium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spirit Shackle turns into Sinister Arrow Raid and has base power 180

splintered-stormshards.Name: Splintered Stormshards

splishy-splash.Name: Splishy Splash

spore.Name: Spore
spore.Effects: Spore puts the target to sleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spore turns into Z-Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above

springtide-storm.Name: Springtide Storm
springtide-storm.Effects: Springtide Storm deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 30% chance of lowering Attack). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each

stealth-rock.Name: Stealth Rock
stealth-rock.Effects: Stealth Rock lays a trap of stones around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. The rocks inflict variable damage — a fraction of the Pokémon's maximum HP, based on its susceptibility to the Rock type, as shown in the table. For example, a Fighting type switching in would lose 1⁄16 their maximum HP since Rock is not very effective against it. A Fire/Flying type would lose 1⁄2 their HP since Rock is super-effective against both Fire and Flying. Stealth Rock can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target). These are the worst Pokémon to switch in on a Stealth Rock trap: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stealth Rock turns into Z-Stealth Rock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
stealth-rock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stealth Rock turns into Z-Stealth Rock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

steam-eruption.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steam Eruption turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.

stone-edge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stone Edge turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.When Lycanroc is holding Lycanium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stone Edge turns into Splintered Stormshards and has base power 190.

stored-power.Name: Stored Power
stored-power.Effects: Stored Power deals varying damage based on the user's stat increases. It starts at base power 20 and increases by 20 for each net stat boost the user has received, including Evasion and Accuracy. In other words the power is: For example, if the Pokémon used Dragon Dance and Double Team once each, that is a total of 3 stat increases (+1 Attack, +1 Speed, +1 Evasion) and Stored Power's base power will be 20 × 3 + 20 = 80. The maximum it could reach (although impractical) if all stats are fully boosted is 20 × 6 × 7 + 20 = a massive 860 base power. (This does not include other boosts - here the Pokémon would have a +6 Special Attack boost meaning a 4× multiplier, plus STAB for most of the Pokémon that can learn Stored Power.) When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stored Power turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160
stored-power.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stored Power turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

storm-throw.Name: Storm Throw

However, Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor, or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Storm Throw will hit them with base power 60. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Storm Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120
storm-throw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Storm Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

					Outside of battle
Strength is used to move large boulders in the field. Boulders can only be pushed, not pulled. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
From Generation 5 onwards, boulders moved by Strength are often used to create shortcuts through caves and routes
