string-shot.Effects: String Shot lowers the target's Speed by two stages. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, String Shot turns into Z-String Shot and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
string-shot.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, String Shot turns into Z-String Shot and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

struggle.Name: Struggle
struggle.Effects:
Only usable when all PP are gone. Hurts the user.					
					Changes

In Generations 1-3, Struggle has 100% accuracy.
struggle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 1.
struggle.Target: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.

struggle-bug.Name: Struggle Bug
struggle-bug.Effects: Struggle Bug deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle Bug turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100
struggle-bug.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle Bug turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

stuff-cheeks.Name: Stuff Cheeks
stuff-cheeks.Effects: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.							(100% chance

stun-spore.Name: Stun Spore
stun-spore.Effects: Stun Spore paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stun Spore turns into Z-Stun Spore and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
stun-spore.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stun Spore turns into Z-Stun Spore and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

submission.Name: Submission
submission.Effects: Submission deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Submission turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160
submission.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Submission turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.

substitute.Name: Substitute
substitute.Effects: Uses HP to creates a decoy that takes hits.
substitute.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Substitute turns into Z-Substitute and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

subzero-slammer.Name: Subzero Slammer
subzero-slammer.Effects: Subzero Slammer is the Ice type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

sucker-punch.Name: Sucker Punch
sucker-punch.Effects: Sucker Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. However, the move only works if the target uses a direct attack in the same turn. If the target is not preparing an attack, Sucker Punch will fail. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sucker Punch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140
sucker-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sucker Punch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140.

sunny-day.Name: Sunny Day
sunny-day.Effects: Sunny Day causes bright sunlight that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunny Day turns into Z-Sunny Day and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sunny-day.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunny Day turns into Z-Sunny Day and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sunsteel-strike.Name: Sunsteel Strike
sunsteel-strike.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunsteel Strike turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.When Solgaleo or Dusk Mane Necrozma is holding Solganium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunsteel Strike turns into Searing Sunraze Smash and has base power 200.

super-fang.Name: Super Fang
super-fang.Effects: Always takes off half of the opponent's HP.
super-fang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Super Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

supercell-slam.Name: Supercell Slam
supercell-slam.Effects: The user electrifies its body and drops onto the target to inflict damage. If this move misses, the user takes damage instead

superpower.Name: Superpower
superpower.Effects: Superpower deals damage but lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Superpower turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190
superpower.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Superpower turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.

supersonic.Name: Supersonic
supersonic.Effects: Supersonic causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. Soundproof also prevents this move. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Supersonic turns into Z-Supersonic and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
supersonic.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Supersonic turns into Z-Supersonic and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

supersonic-skystrike.Name: Supersonic Skystrike
supersonic-skystrike.Effects: Supersonic Skystrike is the Flying type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

surf.Name: Surf
surf.Effects:
Surf deals damage. In double battles it will hit all Pokémon on the field; in triple battles it will hit all adjacent Pokémon. If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive, Surf will hit with double power. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Surf turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Surf is used to cross water. While surfing, wild Pokémon may appear. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
From Generation 3 onward it's possible to fish while surfing; previously one could only fish at the water's edge
surf.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Surf turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
					Outside of battle
Surf is used to cross water. While surfing, wild Pokémon may appear. It can only be used with the appropriate Gym Badge.
From Generation 3 onward it's possible to fish while surfing; previously one could only fish at the water's edge.

surging-strikes.Name: Surging Strikes
surging-strikes.Effects: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes

swagger.Name: Swagger
swagger.Effects: Swagger confuses the target and raises its Attack by two stages. If one of the two effects cannot be invoked (for example the target is already confused or its Attack is already raised to the maximum of +6 stages), Swagger still works and will invoke the other effect. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swagger turns into Z-Swagger and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
swagger.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swagger turns into Z-Swagger and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

swallow.Name: Swallow
swallow.Effects: Swallow recovers a varying amount of HP depending on how many times the user has used Stockpile. It recovers 25%, 50% or 100% of the user's maximum HP if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively. Swallow also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swallow turns into Z-Swallow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
swallow.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swallow turns into Z-Swallow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sweet-kiss.Name: Sweet Kiss
sweet-kiss.Effects: Sweet Kiss causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Kiss turns into Z-Sweet Kiss and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
sweet-kiss.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Kiss turns into Z-Sweet Kiss and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

sweet-scent.Name: Sweet Scent
sweet-scent.Effects:
Sweet Scent lowers the target's Evasion by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Scent turns into Z-Sweet Scent and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
While standing in any area where a Pokémon could appear (e.g. tall grass, in a cave, surfing on water), Sweet Scent will make a wild Pokémon automatically appear. In Generation 6, Sweet Scent will often initiate a Horde Encounter with 5 wild Pokémon.
In Generations 4-5 and Pokémon X/Y, Sweet Scent can only be used when there is no weather condition (e.g. rain) present
sweet-scent.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Scent turns into Z-Sweet Scent and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
While standing in any area where a Pokémon could appear (e.g. tall grass, in a cave, surfing on water), Sweet Scent will make a wild Pokémon automatically appear. In Generation 6, Sweet Scent will often initiate a Horde Encounter with 5 wild Pokémon.
In Generations 4-5 and Pokémon X/Y, Sweet Scent can only be used when there is no weather condition (e.g. rain) present.

swift.Name: Swift
swift.Effects: Swift deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120
swift.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.

switcheroo.Name: Switcheroo
switcheroo.Effects: Switcheroo switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it. Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Switcheroo turns into Z-Switcheroo and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above
switcheroo.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Switcheroo turns into Z-Switcheroo and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

swords-dance.Name: Swords Dance
swords-dance.Effects: Swords Dance raises the user's Attack by two stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swords Dance turns into Z-Swords Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
swords-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swords Dance turns into Z-Swords Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

synchronoise.Name: Synchronoise
synchronoise.Effects: Synchronoise hits all adjacent Pokémon that share a type with the user. Dual type Pokémon match either of their types, so for example a Normal/Flying Pokémon using Synchronoise will hit a Flying/Dragon type. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synchronoise turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190
synchronoise.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synchronoise turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.

synthesis.Name: Synthesis
synthesis.Effects: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
synthesis.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synthesis turns into Z-Synthesis and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

syrup-bomb.Name: Syrup Bomb
syrup-bomb.Effects: Lowers opponent's Speed each turn for 3 turns

tachyon-cutter.Name: Tachyon Cutter
tachyon-cutter.Effects: Guaranteed to hit twice in a row

tackle.Name: Tackle
tackle.Effects: Tackle is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tackle turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
tackle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tackle turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

tail-glow.Name: Tail Glow
tail-glow.Effects: Tail Glow raises the user's Special Attack by three stages. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Tail Glow would raise Special Attack to 2.5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level). When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Glow turns into Z-Tail Glow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above
tail-glow.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Glow turns into Z-Tail Glow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.

tail-slap.Name: Tail Slap
tail-slap.Effects: Tail Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Tail Slap is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Tail Slap to always hit the maximum number of times. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140
tail-slap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.

tail-whip.Name: Tail Whip
tail-whip.Effects: Tail Whip lowers the target's Defense by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Whip turns into Z-Tail Whip and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
tail-whip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Whip turns into Z-Tail Whip and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

tailwind.Name: Tailwind
tailwind.Effects: Tailwind doubles the speed of all Pokémon in the user's party for 4 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tailwind turns into Z-Tailwind and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
tailwind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tailwind turns into Z-Tailwind and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
tailwind.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

take-down.Name: Take Down
take-down.Effects: Take Down deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Take Down turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175
take-down.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Take Down turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.

take-heart.Name: Take Heart
take-heart.Effects: Take Heart heals the user's status conditions, and raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

tar-shot.Name: Tar Shot
tar-shot.Effects: Lowers the opponent's Speed and makes them weaker to Fire-type moves.							(100% chance

taunt.Name: Taunt
taunt.Effects: Taunt prevents the target from using Status-category moves for three turns. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Taunt turns into Z-Taunt and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
taunt.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Taunt turns into Z-Taunt and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

tearful-look.Name: Tearful Look
tearful-look.Effects: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats.							(100% chance)
tearful-look.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tearful Look turns into Z-Tearful Look and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

teatime.Name: Teatime
teatime.Effects: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat their berries

techno-blast.Name: Techno Blast
techno-blast.Effects: Techno Blast deals damage. Its type changes depending on the held Drive: Techno Blast is the signature move of Genesect. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Techno Blast turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
techno-blast.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Techno Blast turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

tectonic-rage.Name: Tectonic Rage
tectonic-rage.Effects: Tectonic Rage is the Ground type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

teeter-dance.Name: Teeter Dance
teeter-dance.Effects: Teeter Dance causes all adjacent Pokémon to become confused. In single battles this is simply the opponent; in double/triple battles it includes all adjacent opponents and teammate(s). Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teeter Dance turns into Z-Teeter Dance and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
teeter-dance.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teeter Dance turns into Z-Teeter Dance and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

telekinesis.Name: Telekinesis
telekinesis.Effects: Telekinesis raises the target into the air for three turns, guaranteeing that all attacks against the target (except OHKO moves) will hit, regardless of Accuracy or Evasion. The target gains the usual benefits of being raised, e.g. immunity to Ground-type moves. More details, including when Telekinesis can't be used, are in the glossary. The effect is cancelled if the raised Pokémon is hit by Smack Down. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Telekinesis turns into Z-Telekinesis and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
telekinesis.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Telekinesis turns into Z-Telekinesis and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

teleport.Name: Teleport
teleport.Effects:
In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee and Pokémon Sword/Shield, Teleport switches the user out. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teleport turns into Z-Teleport and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
If you are outside, Teleport will instantly transport you back to the last Pokémon Center you visited. It does not work in caves or buildings. In Generation 4 it does not work in any town or city, only in routes
teleport.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teleport turns into Z-Teleport and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
					Outside of battle
If you are outside, Teleport will instantly transport you back to the last Pokémon Center you visited. It does not work in caves or buildings. In Generation 4 it does not work in any town or city, only in routes.

temper-flare.Name: Temper Flare
temper-flare.Effects: Spurred by desperation, the user attacks the target. This move’s power is doubled if the user’s previous move failed

tera-blast.Name: Tera Blast
tera-blast.Effects: Tera Blast deals damage, and its type changes to the user's Tera Type, when the Pokémon is Terastallized. Tera Blast uses the Pokémon's Attack or Special Attack stat, whichever is higher

tera-starstorm.Name: Tera Starstorm
tera-starstorm.Effects: With the power of its crystals, the user bombards and eliminates the target. When used by Terapagos in its Stellar Form, this move damages all opposing Pokémon

terrain-pulse.Name: Terrain Pulse
terrain-pulse.Effects: The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack. This move’s type and power changes depending on the terrain when it’s used. Terrain Pulse is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

thief.Name: Thief
thief.Effects: Thief deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not holding an item. Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. If the item would activate on attack (e.g. Focus Band), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e.g. Focus Sash) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thief turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120
thief.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thief turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.

thousand-arrows.Name: Thousand Arrows
thousand-arrows.Effects: Thousand Arrows deals damage and knocks the target(s) to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Thousand Arrows can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Arrows turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180
thousand-arrows.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Arrows turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.

thousand-waves.Name: Thousand Waves
thousand-waves.Effects: Thousand Waves deals damage and prevents the target(s) from fleeing or switching out, as long as the user remains in battle. When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Waves turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175
thousand-waves.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Waves turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.

thrash.Name: Thrash
thrash.Effects: The user of Thrash attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack. If Thrash is disrupted (e.g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thrash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
thrash.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thrash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
thrash.Target: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.

throat-chop.Name: Throat Chop
throat-chop.Effects: Throat Chop deals damage and prevents the target from using sound-based moves such as Hyper Voice for two turns. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Throat Chop turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160
throat-chop.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Throat Chop turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.

thunder.Name: Thunder
thunder.Effects: Thunder deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If used during rain, Thunder ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight, its accuracy drops to 50%. Thunder can hit Pokémon during the first stage of Bounce, Fly or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 185
thunder.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 185.

thunder-cage.Name: Thunder Cage
thunder-cage.Effects: Deals damage and traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns

thunder-fang.Name: Thunder Fang
thunder-fang.Effects: Thunder Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Fang turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120
thunder-fang.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Fang turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.

thunder-punch.Name: Thunder Punch
thunder-punch.Effects: Thunder Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Punch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140
thunder-punch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Punch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140.

thunder-shock.Name: Thunder Shock
thunder-shock.Effects: Thunder Shock deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Shock turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100
thunder-shock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Shock turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.

thunder-wave.Name: Thunder Wave
thunder-wave.Effects: Thunder Wave paralyzes the opponent. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Wave turns into Z-Thunder Wave and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
thunder-wave.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Wave turns into Z-Thunder Wave and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

thunderbolt.Name: Thunderbolt
thunderbolt.Effects: Thunderbolt deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.When Alolan Raichu is holding Aloraichium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Stoked Sparksurfer and has base power 175.When Pikachu in a cap is holding Pikashunium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt and has base power 195
thunderbolt.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.When Alolan Raichu is holding Aloraichium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Stoked Sparksurfer and has base power 175.When Pikachu in a cap is holding Pikashunium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into 10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt and has base power 195.

tickle.Name: Tickle
tickle.Effects: Tickle lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage each. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tickle turns into Z-Tickle and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
tickle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tickle turns into Z-Tickle and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

tidy-up.Name: Tidy Up
tidy-up.Effects: Removes the effects of entry hazards and Substitute, and boosts user’s Attack and Speed

topsy-turvy.Name: Topsy-Turvy
topsy-turvy.Effects: Topsy-Turvy reverses the stat changes of the target Pokémon. For example, if the target has boosted their attack by 2 stages using Swords Dance, Topsy-Turvy will reduce their Attack down to -2 stages. Similarly, if the opponent has used Draco Meteor (lowering their Special Attack), Topsy-Turvy will raise their Special Attack to +2 stages. When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Topsy-Turvy turns into Z-Topsy-Turvy and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
topsy-turvy.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Topsy-Turvy turns into Z-Topsy-Turvy and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

torment.Name: Torment
torment.Effects: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.
torment.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Torment turns into Z-Torment and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

toxic.Name: Toxic
toxic.Effects: Toxic causes the target to be badly poisoned. Pokémon that are badly poisoned will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn. The affected Pokémon will lose 1⁄16 of its maximum HP at the end of the first turn, which then increases by 1⁄16 each turn. In other words, they lose 1⁄16, 1⁄8, 3⁄16, 1⁄4 and so on. If used by a Poison-type Pokémon, Toxic will always hit, even if the target is in the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. Toxic doesn't affect Pokémon already carrying a major status ailment, Pokémon behind a Substitute nor Poison- or Steel-type Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic turns into Z-Toxic and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
toxic.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic turns into Z-Toxic and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

toxic-spikes.Name: Toxic Spikes
toxic-spikes.Effects: Toxic Spikes lays a trap of poisonous spikes around the foe, which poison Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. If used more than once, incoming Pokémon will be badly poisoned. The spikes will not poison any raised Pokémon, nor does it affect Poison or Steel types, nor Pokémon with the abilities Immunity or Magic Guard. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. Toxic Spikes can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target). Poison type Pokémon (that are not raised) will absorb the spikes upon switching in, removing their effect. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Spikes turns into Z-Toxic Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
toxic-spikes.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Spikes turns into Z-Toxic Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
toxic-spikes.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.

toxic-thread.Name: Toxic Thread
toxic-thread.Effects: Toxic Thread poisons the target, and lowers its Speed by one stage. Each effect still occurs if the other cannot, for example a Poison type Pokémon will still have its Speed reduced. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Thread turns into Z-Toxic Thread and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
toxic-thread.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Thread turns into Z-Toxic Thread and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

trailblaze.Name: Trailblaze
trailblaze.Effects: Trailblaze deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage

transform.Name: Transform
transform.Effects: User takes on the form and attacks of the opponent.
transform.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Transform turns into Z-Transform and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

tri-attack.Name: Tri Attack
tri-attack.Effects: Tri Attack deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing, burning or freezing the target - i.e. a 6.67% chance of each status condition. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tri Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
tri-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tri Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

trick.Name: Trick
trick.Effects: Trick switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it. Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle. Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick turns into Z-Trick and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above
trick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick turns into Z-Trick and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

trick-room.Name: Trick Room
trick-room.Effects: Slower Pokémon move first in the turn for 5 turns.
trick-room.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick Room turns into Z-Trick Room and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

trick-or-treat.Name: Trick-or-Treat
trick-or-treat.Effects: Trick-or-Treat adds the Ghost type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon. It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Ghost. If the target is under the effect of Forest's Curse the Grass type is replaced by Ghost. When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick-or-Treat turns into Z-Trick-or-Treat and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above
trick-or-treat.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick-or-Treat turns into Z-Trick-or-Treat and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.

triple-arrows.Name: Triple Arrows
triple-arrows.Effects: Triple Arrows deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio (1⁄8 instead of 1⁄24). It has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage, and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch

triple-axel.Name: Triple Axel
triple-axel.Effects: A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit. Triple Axel is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC

triple-kick.Name: Triple Kick
triple-kick.Effects: Triple Kick deals damage and will strike three times, with each kick's base power increasing by 10. In other words the blows will be base power 10, 20 and 30 - a total of 60. Each hit has its own accuracy check, and if one kick misses, the move ends. Therefore, the chances of it being successful for each number of hits (with normal Accuracy/Evasion) are 90%, 81% and 73% respectively. Each strike of Triple Kick is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Triple Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120
triple-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Triple Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.

trop-kick.Name: Trop Kick
trop-kick.Effects: Trop Kick deals damage and lowers the target's Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trop Kick turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140
trop-kick.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trop Kick turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.

trump-card.Name: Trump Card
trump-card.Effects: Trump Card inflicts more damage when fewer PP are left, as per the table. The power is calculated based on the PP remaining after the move has been used; this is to account for the ability Pressure which deducts 2 PP for each move. If Trump Card is selected via a different move such as Metronome or Sleep Talk, it uses the PP of that move to determine the power. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trump Card turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
trump-card.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trump Card turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

twineedle.Name: Twineedle
twineedle.Effects: Twineedle deals damage and will strike twice (with 25 base power each time). It has a 20% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Each strike of Twineedle is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twineedle turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100
twineedle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twineedle turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.

twinkle-tackle.Name: Twinkle Tackle
twinkle-tackle.Effects: Twinkle Tackle is the Fairy type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon

twister.Name: Twister
twister.Effects: Twister deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Twister can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stages of Bounce, Fly and Sky Drop - and in the case of Bounce and Fly, inflicts double damage. When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twister turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100
twister.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twister turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.

u-turn.Name: U-turn
u-turn.Effects: User switches out immediately after attacking.
u-turn.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, U-turn turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.

upper-hand.Name: Upper Hand
upper-hand.Effects: Strikes before a target's priority move

uproar.Name: Uproar
uproar.Effects: Uproar inflicts damage for 3 turns. During this time, no Pokémon on the field will be able to sleep, and any sleeping Pokémon will be woken up. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Uproar turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175
uproar.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Uproar turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
uproar.Target: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.

v-create.Name: V-create
v-create.Effects: V-create deals damage but lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each after attacking. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, V-create turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 220
v-create.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, V-create turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 220.

vacuum-wave.Name: Vacuum Wave
vacuum-wave.Effects: Vacuum Wave deals damage and has a priority of +1. Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vacuum Wave turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100
vacuum-wave.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vacuum Wave turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.

veevee-volley.Name: Veevee Volley
veevee-volley.Effects: Veevee Volley is an Eevee-exclusive Partner Power from Pokémon Let's Go. The power increases when Eevee's Friendship is higher (similar to Return), up to a maximum base power of 102. When a different Pokémon is in battle, Veevee Volley may be used to boost that Pokémon's stats

venom-drench.Name: Venom Drench
venom-drench.Effects: If the target is poisoned, Venom Drench lowers its Attack, Special Attack and Speed by one stage each. When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venom Drench turns into Z-Venom Drench and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
venom-drench.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venom Drench turns into Z-Venom Drench and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

venoshock.Name: Venoshock
venoshock.Effects: Inflicts double damage if the target is poisoned.
venoshock.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venoshock turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 120.

victory-dance.Name: Victory Dance
victory-dance.Effects: Victory Dance raises the user's Attack, Defense and Speed by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each

vine-whip.Name: Vine Whip
vine-whip.Effects: Vine Whip deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vine Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100
vine-whip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vine Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

vise-grip.Name: Vise Grip
vise-grip.Effects: Vise Grip deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vise Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
vise-grip.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vise Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

vital-throw.Name: Vital Throw
vital-throw.Effects: Vital Throw deals damage with lower priority, so most attacks will take place before it. Vital Throw ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force or Sky Drop. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vital Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140
vital-throw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vital Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

volt-switch.Name: Volt Switch
volt-switch.Effects: User must switch out after attacking.
volt-switch.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Switch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140.

volt-tackle.Name: Volt Tackle
volt-tackle.Effects: Volt Tackle deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.When Pikachu is holding Pikanium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Catastropika and has base power 210
volt-tackle.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.When Pikachu is holding Pikanium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Catastropika and has base power 210.

wake-up-slap.Name: Wake-Up Slap
wake-up-slap.Effects: Wake-Up Slap deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is asleep. However, it also wakes up the target. When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wake-Up Slap turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140
wake-up-slap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wake-Up Slap turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.

water-gun.Name: Water Gun
water-gun.Effects: Water Gun deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Gun turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100
water-gun.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Gun turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

water-pledge.Name: Water Pledge
water-pledge.Effects: Water Pledge deals damage at base power 80. If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Fire Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear. The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move. When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting. If Water Pledge is used with Grass Pledge, the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns. If Water Pledge is used with Fire Pledge, the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pledge turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160
water-pledge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pledge turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.

water-pulse.Name: Water Pulse
water-pulse.Effects: Water Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target. Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120
water-pulse.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.
water-pulse.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

water-shuriken.Name: Water Shuriken
water-shuriken.Effects: Water Shuriken attacks with increased priority. Water Shuriken hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit. Each strike of Water Shuriken is treated like a separate attack: The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage. The Skill Link ability will cause Water Shuriken to always hit the maximum number of times. If Battle Bond is active, Water Shuriken always hits 3 times, each with 20 base power. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Shuriken turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100
water-shuriken.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Shuriken turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.

water-sport.Name: Water Sport
water-sport.Effects: Water Sport reduces the power of Fire-type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field. Most Pokémon that learn Water Sport are part Water type and thus already resistant to Fire attacks. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Sport turns into Z-Water Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
water-sport.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Sport turns into Z-Water Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

water-spout.Name: Water Spout
water-spout.Effects: Water Spout inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is: Water Spout is a counterpart move to Eruption. It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out, based on the user rather than the opponent. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Spout turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200
water-spout.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Spout turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200.

waterfall.Name: Waterfall
waterfall.Effects:
Waterfall deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Waterfall turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
Allows a surfing Pokémon to ascend a waterfall. In Diamond, Pearl & Platinum, Waterfall is required to descend waterfalls, but in other games it is not
waterfall.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Waterfall turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
					Outside of battle
Allows a surfing Pokémon to ascend a waterfall. In Diamond, Pearl & Platinum, Waterfall is required to descend waterfalls, but in other games it is not.

wave-crash.Name: Wave Crash
wave-crash.Effects: Wave Crash deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP

weather-ball.Name: Weather Ball
weather-ball.Effects: The power and type of Weather Ball changes with the weather. With no weather condition it is Normal and has a base power of 50. If a weather condition is in effect, its power doubles to 100 and the move becomes a different type: Weather Ball will receive STAB where appropriate - for example by Vanilluxe during a hailstorm, or Castform during sun, rain or hail since it transforms into the appropriate type. In sun and rain, the power of Weather Ball will gain an additional 50% power because Fire- and Water-type moves are boosted respectively in those conditions. (Other weather conditions don't receive any type boost.) When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Weather Ball turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160
weather-ball.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Weather Ball turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.

whirlpool.Name: Whirlpool
whirlpool.Effects:
Whirlpool inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent in the vortex, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive, Whirlpool will hit with double power. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlpool turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Whirlpool allows you to cross swirling maelstroms in your path. Only Generation 2 and Generation 4 have whirlpools that can be passed
whirlpool.Z Effects:
When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlpool turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
					Outside of battle
Whirlpool allows you to cross swirling maelstroms in your path. Only Generation 2 and Generation 4 have whirlpools that can be passed.

whirlwind.Name: Whirlwind
whirlwind.Effects: In the wild, Whirlwind blows the target Pokémon away if they are of a lower level, and the battle ends. In trainer battles (including linked battles), Whirlwind forces the target to switch out of battle (regardless of level) and is replaced with another Pokémon in the trainer's team. Pokémon with the ability Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Whirlwind. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlwind turns into Z-Whirlwind and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
whirlwind.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlwind turns into Z-Whirlwind and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

wicked-blow.Name: Wicked Blow
wicked-blow.Effects:
Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.					
					Changes

In Generation 8, Wicked Blow has 80 base power

wicked-torque.Name: Wicked Torque
wicked-torque.Effects: Wicked Torque deals damage and has a 10% chance of putting the target to sleep. Only the Revavroom used by Team Star has this move

wide-guard.Name: Wide Guard
wide-guard.Effects: Wide Guard protects the user's team from all multi-target moves (such as Surf or Rock Slide), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves. The accuracy of Wide Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Quick Guard. However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect, Detect, Endure, Spiky Shield, King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1⁄3 each time it or Quick Guard is used. When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wide Guard turns into Z-Wide Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
wide-guard.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wide Guard turns into Z-Wide Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
wide-guard.Target: Targets all Pokémon on the user’s team.

wild-charge.Name: Wild Charge
wild-charge.Effects: Wild Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wild Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175
wild-charge.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wild Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.

wildbolt-storm.Name: Wildbolt Storm
wildbolt-storm.Effects: Wildbolt Storm deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing the target. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 20% chance of paralysis). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If used during rain, Wildbolt Storm ignores accuracy

will-o-wisp.Name: Will-O-Wisp
will-o-wisp.Effects: Will-O-Wisp causes the target to become burned, if it hits. Burned Pokémon lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP each turn and their Attack is decreased by 50%. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Will-O-Wisp turns into Z-Will-O-Wisp and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
will-o-wisp.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Will-O-Wisp turns into Z-Will-O-Wisp and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

wing-attack.Name: Wing Attack
wing-attack.Effects: Wing Attack deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles. When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wing Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120
wing-attack.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wing Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
wing-attack.Target: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.

wish.Name: Wish
wish.Effects: The user recovers HP in the following turn.
wish.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wish turns into Z-Wish and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

withdraw.Name: Withdraw
withdraw.Effects: Withdraw raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Withdraw turns into Z-Withdraw and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
withdraw.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Withdraw turns into Z-Withdraw and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

wonder-room.Name: Wonder Room
wonder-room.Effects: Wonder Room switches the Defense and Special Defense of all Pokémon in battle, for 5 turns. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wonder Room turns into Z-Wonder Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
wonder-room.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wonder Room turns into Z-Wonder Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

wood-hammer.Name: Wood Hammer
wood-hammer.Effects: Wood Hammer deals damage, but the user receives 1⁄3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wood Hammer turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190
wood-hammer.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wood Hammer turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.

work-up.Name: Work Up
work-up.Effects: Work Up raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Work Up turns into Z-Work Up and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
work-up.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Work Up turns into Z-Work Up and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

worry-seed.Name: Worry Seed
worry-seed.Effects: Worry Seed changes the target's ability to Insomnia, which prevents the Pokémon from falling asleep. If the move is used on a sleeping Pokémon, it will wake up on its next turn. Worry Seed does not work on Pokémon with the ability Truant or Multitype. When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Worry Seed turns into Z-Worry Seed and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
worry-seed.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Worry Seed turns into Z-Worry Seed and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

wrap.Name: Wrap
wrap.Effects: Wrap inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns. If the user holds a Grip Claw, the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1⁄6 of the target's maximum HP. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wrap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100
wrap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wrap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.

wring-out.Name: Wring Out
wring-out.Effects: Wring Out inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i.e. the power is: Wring Out is a Special-category counterpart move to Crush Grip. It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption, based on the opponent rather than the user. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wring Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190
wring-out.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wring Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.

x-scissor.Name: X-Scissor
x-scissor.Effects: X-Scissor deals damage with no additional effect. When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, X-Scissor turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160
x-scissor.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, X-Scissor turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.

yawn.Name: Yawn
yawn.Effects: Yawn makes the target drowsy on the turn it is used. If the target is still on the field at the end of the next turn, it falls asleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit, or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Yawn turns into Z-Yawn and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above
yawn.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Yawn turns into Z-Yawn and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

zap-cannon.Name: Zap Cannon
zap-cannon.Effects: Zap Cannon deals damage and paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6). Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zap Cannon turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190
zap-cannon.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zap Cannon turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.

zen-headbutt.Name: Zen Headbutt
zen-headbutt.Effects: Zen Headbutt deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zen Headbutt turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160
zen-headbutt.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zen Headbutt turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.

zing-zap.Name: Zing Zap
zing-zap.Z Effects: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zing Zap turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

zippy-zap.Name: Zippy Zap
zippy-zap.Effects: Zippy Zap deals damage with high priority and always results in a critical hit. Zippy Zap is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Splishy Splash and Floaty Fall
